**The Supreme Perfection Jade Emperor’s Illuminated Precepts of the Four Poles**

**Sutra Title:** *The Supreme Perfection Jade Emperor’s Illuminated Precepts of the Four Poles* (abbreviated as *Illuminated Precepts of the Four Poles*).
Author unknown, approximately composed during the late Eastern Jin dynasty. A foundational disciplinary code of the early Shangqing tradition. Five scrolls.
Source text: *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, *Dongzhen* section, *Precepts and Disciplines* category.

---

### *The Supreme Perfection Jade Emperor’s Illuminated Precepts of the Four Poles*
**Scroll One**

At that time, the Most High Great Dao Lord bestowed upon the August Supreme Perfection Jade Emperor the *Illuminated Precepts of the Four Poles*, a code of one hundred and twenty statutes, to inspect the Heavenly Perfected Ones above, examine the Flying Immortals in the middle, and adjudicate the transgressions of the guilty below.

This jade scripture emerged from the annotations of the August Supreme Governor, enshrined within the Sevenfold Radiant Purple Chamber of the Lofty Jade Void. Its jade splendor formed the canon, golden immortals scattered incense, and five hundred million divine soldiers of the Five Thearchs, along with flying essence-clad cavalry, guarded the sacred text. Its reckoning spans the endless kalpas, presiding over the five transformations of fortune and the ninefold changes of sovereignty. When the time comes to assess the Perfected Ones who assist in the sagely governance, those with golden bones and jade viscera, bearing the Dark Chart and Purple Tablets, their names inscribed in the Upper Clarity, shall transmit the precepts in accordance with the code.

The Most High addressed the Golden Portal Emperor Lord, dispatching the Nine Numinous Jade Consorts to cast gold into tablets, bound with silver, while the Mother of Tortoises wielded the brush, the Supreme Perfection swept the mat, the Purple Dawn scattered incense, and the Great Florescence held the towel. Within the Purple Chamber of purity, they transcribed the jade scripture, then sealed it in a cloud-brocade pouch with cinnabar and azure seals.

Thereupon, the Most High Great Dao Lord led the Twenty-Four Emperors of the Lofty Jade Void and the Thirty-Nine Perfected Ones upward to the Radiant Purple Palace of the Utmost Utmost Utmost Non-Radiant Qi, where golden splendor and jade halls unfolded in ninefold chambers. They summoned the divine soldiers of the Five Thearchs, the ten million officials of the Four Poles, along with venomous dragons and colossal beasts, to guard the Ten Heavens.

At that moment, canopies of flowing rosy clouds and a thousand Perfected Ones of the Mulberry Grove, bearing nine-colored standards, flanked the numinous gates. Divine simurghs chanted in the dark, purple phoenixes wheeled in flight, jade flutes resounded with piercing tones, and the numinous chimes of the Jade Grove echoed. Golden blossoms scattered fragrance, jade consorts wafted incense, and the Four Assemblies of the Flying Empyrean converged with the Eightfold Penetrations of the Cavern Clarity. The Three Luminaries paused their radiance, night candles shone brightly, molten gold unleashed its might, and fiery bells blazed in descent. The Five Dawns aligned in brilliance, the Seven Primes subdued their essences, and a hundred million chariots with ten thousand cavalry filled the Purple Court in lush abundance.

The August Supreme Jade Emperor commanded the Jade Maidens of the Upper Palace—Xu Farong, Xiao Yizhong, Tian Sifei, Li Yunmen, and others—to strike the cloud-harp’s zither and join their voices in chanting the hymns of the Great Cavern’s lofty purity and the verses of the Three Paths’ dew-laden suffering.

The jade wisdom flutes rang clear, celestial melodies unfolded subtly, divine jade chimes trembled with resonance, and golden tones soared in emptiness. The transformative power reached the multitudes, unifying the myriad mechanisms at their inception.

**The Hymn:**

The Great Cavern encompasses the Three Wheels,
The primordial transformation holds form and formlessness.
Silent as a rootless teaching,
Solemn as a numinous might.

Alas, within the Three Paths,
Sorrow and suffering arise therefrom.
Through diligent study of these precepts,
Accumulate goodness to exhaust the kalpa’s span.

When the kalpa ends, transform and be reborn—
Body like a celestial brick, peer to sun and moon.
Foolishness follows worldly fancies,
Fleeting learning seeks vain glory.

Proclaiming transformation without discipline,
Lightly leaking the Heavenly Treasures’ scriptures,
Violating the code to enter death’s gate—
The Four Poles bind your name.

Soul and spirit tread the Nine Perils,
The Five Sufferings ever entangle you.
Feeding on fire, treading the Blade Mountains,
Hardship knows no moment’s respite.

Bewail this source of fortune and misfortune,
So clear amidst the vast and distant.
The Most High bequeaths stern precepts,
Fortune and misfortune move one to sigh.

The Dao of immortality is fated by destiny,
In darkness, it is already decreed.
Without destiny, it does not unfold;
Once awakened, one endures constant sorrow.

If one can revere the Dark Code,
Naturally one transcends the empyrean.
But if mired in the toils of love and desire,
Why persist in arrogance and frivolity?

Dwelling in transgression, the Four Luminaries bind,
Life and death tread the Eight Perils.
Dragged through the Five Sufferings’ courts,
The Three Paths’ knots remain unbroken.

The soul sinks into the Nine Darks’ plunder,
Ten thousand kalpas without dawn’s reprieve.
Grieve for this teaching of the Primordial Beginning—
How can it not evoke lament?

Vast and distant, above the Nine Mysteries,
Obscure, at the dawn of transformation’s inception.
Without form, without shadow,
Without depth, without measure.

The Two Modes initiate the unfolding of destiny,
Condensing qi to form sediment.
The Three Dawns illuminate the Dark Chamber,
The Five and Nine establish discipline.

Fortune and misfortune arise from humanity,
Good and evil—who indeed prevails?
If one can awaken to the Dark Enlightenment,
Transcendently rise above lofty doubts.

But if one wields the axe that hews fate,
Accumulating transgressions to fill the heart—
Sinking in guilt, the Four Luminaries bind,
The old punishments are truly deserved.

Born bearing the Blade Mountains,
The Five Sufferings know no end.
The Seven Mysteries fill the dark night,
Ten thousand kalpas mark a single epoch.

Lingering in the Three Paths,
Unawakened to life and death.

Thus did the Most High Sagely Perfected Jade Emperor and the Supreme Dawn Great Master, leading the Immortal Jade Lords, wield the feathered staff of ascension and the jade-script imperial decrees, proclaiming to the Five Spirits. The Jade Bureau upheld its position, the myriad emperors attended at the throne, the Radiant August One inaugurated the oath, and the Luminous Statutes were reverently conferred upon the Most High Great Dao Lord.

The Dao Lord received the Mysterious Precepts and, at that time, transmitted them to the Later Sage Ninefold Mystery Golden Portal Emperor Lord, charging him to govern the Upper Clarity above, the Ten Heavens in the middle, and the myriad multitudes below, to oversee all immortals, and to universally proclaim to the myriad perfected. He was to examine and establish the Mysterious Charts and Purple Writs of the Azure Palace, whose names were inscribed in the Jade Emperor’s register, and to confer them upon later disciples, that all might know the precepts and cultivate their practice in accordance with the statutes.

The Later Sage Emperor Lord reverently received the *Four Poles Luminous Statutes* from the Most High Great Dao Lord and sealed them within the Golden Portal Purple Terrace Jade-Lustered Seven-Treasured Palace. After one thousand seven hundred years, they were transmitted to the Prime Minister Azure Lad, who in turn transmitted them to the Supreme Ultimate Perfected One, the Vermilion Lord of the Southern Marchmount, the Lord of the Western City, the Immortal Earl of the Mysterious Continent, the Ninefold Numinous Prince, and the twenty-four Perfected Ones.

The Lord of the Western City sealed one copy within the Jade Chamber of the northwest of Mount Wangwu, where it shall remain for ten thousand kalpas before being transmitted to those later disciples who attain the Dao. Should one possess the Mysterious Charts and jade-inscribed name, with golden bones and purple concealment, they shall obtain this text—those who do shall become immortals and ascend to heaven in broad daylight.

Thirty-six Jade Lads and thirty-six Jade Maidens attend the text, safeguarding the bodies of those who uphold the statutes, recording merits and illuminating virtue. One must diligently and cautiously observe these precepts, abiding by the sacred covenant and treasuring its secrecy. It must not be lightly transmitted. Should the numinous scriptures be divulged, the nine generations of one’s ancestors shall be consigned to the toil of the Primal Exhaustion, bearing mountains and transporting stones to fill the River of the Dark Night, swallowing fire and devouring coals. For ten thousand kalpas, they shall know no pardon; their bodies shall perish in the Dark Springs, and they shall make amends to the Three Officials.

The Three Officials of the Highest Clarity Subtle Heaven and the Mysterious Three Heavens, overseen by the Jade Emperor’s Surveillance Immortal Lords, command fifty thousand divine soldiers of the Five Emperors. The First Left Office governs the offenses of negligence toward the Most High Perfected Jade Emperor. The Second Right Office investigates the crimes of divulging celestial treasures. The Third Yin Office oversees the transgressions of the Primordial Lords in violating the statutory prohibitions.

The Three Officials of the Yu-Yu Heaven, administered by the Perfected Ones and the Jade Lords who oversee transgressions, command fifty thousand divine soldiers of the Five Emperors. The First Left Office governs yang offenses: the crimes of violence, killing, rebellion, theft of celestial treasures, divulging numinous texts, and perjurious curses. The Second Right Office governs yin offenses: the crimes of harboring treacherous plots, scheming against the worthy and able, and entertaining un-Dao-like thoughts. The Third Capital Office governs the offenses of doubting the celestial perfected, lacking reverence and faith, slandering celestial treasures, wavering in resolve, treating the Daoist scriptures lightly, and defiling the numinous texts.

The Three Officials of the Great Red Heaven, who oversee the surveillance of numinous emissaries, command fifty thousand divine soldiers of the Five Emperors. The First Left Office governs the crimes of the living. The Second Right Office governs the crimes of the dead. The Third Yin Office governs the crimes of women. Additionally, there are the Left and Right Offices of Water and Fire. The Left Water Office governs the offenses of false speech, slander, malicious gossip, envy of the worthy and harm to the able, disbelief in the celestial perfected, doubting talismans and registers, disparaging sacred texts, recklessly discoursing on heaven and earth, divulging secret scriptures, defaming the Two Modes, and offending the Three Luminaries. The Right Fire Office governs the crimes of great rebellion, killing living beings, harming one’s masters and lords, plotting against parents, malicious intent, and entertaining un-Dao-like thoughts.

The Great Mound Mountain also has the Left and Right Offices of Wind and Blade. The Left Wind Examination Office governs the offenses of receiving scriptures, talismans, treasured instructions, and covenants without proper vows, loving wealth and despising the Dao, and violating celestial statutes. The Second Right Blade Examination Office governs the crimes of breaking vows and covenants, betraying masters and friends, abandoning one for another, debating good and evil, and attacking the root of the Dao—offenses of profound disloyalty.

Within the Mysterious Center lie the Three Great Vacuities, which are the domains governed by the Three Officials. The Upper Three Officials govern the Jade Void of the Great Mystery above. The Middle Three Officials govern the Great Vacuity of the Upper Clarity. The Lower Three Officials govern the Great Vacuity of the Supreme Ultimate. All reside within the Mysterious Vacuity, above the Hollow Caverns, where nine bureaus are separately established within the Mysterious Vacuity Grotto Chambers of the Five Marchmounts. There is no crime or punishment that does not fall under the jurisdiction of the Three Officials and Nine Bureaus.

The Knife Mountains lie north of Mount Tai, above the Hollow Caverns of the Lesser Heaven, encircling seven thousand *li*. Above them are one hundred twenty offices and one thousand two hundred subordinate officials, commanding fifty thousand divine soldiers who mete out punishments. Those who have committed crimes against the Three Officials, their souls after death, are made to ascend and descend the mountains. For ten thousand kalpas, they endure one lashing; after three lashings, their suffering souls may proceed to the Land of Flowing Fire.

The Land of Flowing Fire lies south of Mount Huo, within the Vast Yang Cavern Court, encircling five thousand *li*. The sinful souls are all consigned to this fiery realm, where they feed on fire and devour coals, their emaciated souls enduring agony. For ten thousand kalpas, they endure one lashing; after three lashings, they are assigned to the toil of the Three Paths, bearing the soil of Mount Meng to fill the River of the Dark Night. Only after three lashings may they return to the path of rebirth among the unenlightened.

The Three Paths are all connected to the Azure Upper Palace of the Great Mystery Woman in Mount Fengdu, located in the northern *gui* region. Upon this mountain are eight prisons: the First Celestial Surveillance Prison, the Second Celestial Equilibrium Prison, the Third Void Prison, the Fourth Natural Prison, the Fifth Ninefold Equilibrium Prison, the Sixth Clarion Decree Prison, the Seventh Mysterious Heaven Prison, and the Eighth Primordial Rectitude Prison—these eight prisons are overseen by the Upper Heaven Three Officials.

At the mountain’s center are another eight prisons: the First Mysterious Sands Northern Prison, the Second August Heaven Prison, the Third Prohibitive Punishment Prison, the Fourth Mysterious Wonder Prison, the Fifth Punitive Rectitude Prison, the Sixth Statutory Decree Prison, the Seventh Nine Heavens Prison, and the Eighth Clarion Jade Prison—these eight prisons are overseen by the Middle Heaven Three Officials.

Beneath the mountain are yet another eight prisons: the First Boundless Prison, the Second Great Perfected Prison, the Third Mysterious Capital Prison, the Fourth Thirty-Six Heavens Great Prison, the Fifth Heaven One Northern Prison, the Sixth River Earl Prison, the Seventh Kalpic Accumulation Prison, and the Eighth Azure Woman Prison—these eight prisons are overseen by the Lower Three Officials.

The twenty-four prisons are all situated north of Mount Dengdu. Each prison is staffed with twelve subordinate officers and twenty-four hundred mighty celestial enforcers—golden-headed, iron-faced, and wielding golden hammers and iron staves. All souls who violate the Mysterious Statutes and meet death are consigned to their respective prisons, where the enforcers’ iron staves administer punishment. A single lash endures for ten thousand kalpas; only after three lashes may the soul be released to atone for its transgressions in the Three Wretched Realms.

The Most High addressed the Golden Portal Lord of the Imperial Palace, saying: “All people born within the Six Directions of Heaven and Earth yet remain ignorant of their predestined lives and deaths, the roots of sin and fortune—how grievous this is! The causes of good and evil invariably yield their recompense. Those who in life perform meritorious deeds and spread virtue, rescuing and delivering all beings, shall after death transform and be born in halls of fortune, transcending the Eight Difficulties, receiving human felicitations, and earning the natural rewards of Heaven.

Those who in life devote themselves to study, aspire to the Dao of immortals, revere the Mysterious Statutes, honor and believe in the sacred scriptures, turn from evil to embrace goodness, and establish conduct to enter the Real, shall after death transform and be received by the Thearchs. Their names shall be inscribed on purple tablets and ascend to the Jade Dawn, where they shall dwell in the Dao’s joy, undeterred by hardship or cold. Following their masters, they prioritize labor, endure hunger and thirst without complaint, and after death transform to ride flying chariots, roaming and feasting upon the Five Peaks, traversing the void and descending through mist.

Those who in life maintain steadfast integrity, neither licentious nor deceitful, neither greedy nor desirous, unmoved by sensual allure, their hearts as cold as dead ashes, and hold fast to the source of the Dao, shall after death transform and be rewarded as numinous beings, transcending the Three Wretched Realms and sparing themselves the Five Sufferings.

Those who in life perform good deeds, wishing Heaven’s universal deliverance so that all may ascend and escape the Eight Difficulties—even if others remain unenlightened, they themselves find no peace, sacrificing their own garments to relieve the destitute and cold, sharing their provisions with birds, and leaving offerings in desolate mountains—shall be praised by the Four Controllers. Their virtue shall move the Jade Thearch, their names inscribed on purple tablets, and they shall be appointed as ascending immortals.

Those who in life are loyal and filial, reverently serving their elders and superiors, honoring those wiser than themselves, and venerating their masters and lords as if their eyes and bellies were one with their own, their hearts free of arrogance, their speech devoid of frivolity, their inner and outer selves aligned, and their actions in accord with the Real, shall after death transform and become numinous beings. They shall not traverse the Three Wretched Realms nor endure the Eight Difficulties. Goodness begets goodness, fortune begets fortune—such is the Dao’s recompense, which never fails humanity.

Those who in life are wicked, harboring malice and deceit, attacking their masters’ foundations, slandering sacred scriptures, failing to revere the numinous texts, doubting the celestial immortals, feigning virtue for vain glory, speaking falsely while their hearts remain treacherous, betraying the source of the Dao, stealing scriptures without oath, recklessly disseminating them, divulging secret formulas, spreading false teachings, violating statutes and taboos—such souls enter the gates of sin. Their seven generations of ancestors suffer calamity, their destitute spirits are held accountable, their bodies endure flogging after death, consume fire, tread mountains, and endure the Three Wretched Realms and Five Sufferings for ten thousand kalpas without reprieve. Beaten in the dark of night, their pain is unbearable.

Those who wish to cultivate and study must carefully ponder this text. How can the retributions of fortune and misfortune be fully described? Those whose golden names are recorded in the Thearch’s register and whose jade characters are inscribed on purple tablets, who receive and uphold the *One Hundred Twenty Articles of the Luminous Statutes of the Four Poles*, are all destined to become immortals. They must abide by the statutes, cultivate goodness, and follow the Dao, thereby attaining the resonance of divine clarity. The Jade Thearch of the Mysterious Void shall discern their merit, and the Four Controllers shall welcome them in their comings and goings. Near and far, none shall fail to bow in reverence and serve their destined forms.

Disciples must sever all dealings with the mundane, avoiding association with ordinary people, lest they tread the filth of life and death, offend the true numina, consume the five pungent foods, fill their stomachs with turbid qi, deplete their essence and spirit, expose themselves to the Three Luminaries, and slight the Jade Dawn. Such transgressions invite self-inflicted calamity, bringing ruin upon their destined forms. This warning is given in earnest; heed it with care.

Those who receive the *Luminous Statutes* must not recklessly discuss scriptures with ordinary students, debate ancient mysteries, or presume to comprehend the utmost Real. To recklessly transmit or divulge the source of the Dao, or show it to worldly people, shall bring calamity upon their seven generations of ancestors and their dead souls, consigning them to eternal atonement at the River Source, their forms enslaved in the Nine Dark Realms, their suffering beyond words.

Those who receive and uphold the supreme methods and cultivate the *Luminous Statutes* must, on the eight solar terms and their own life-destiny days, purify themselves with fasting, burn incense, and repent before the Imperial Lord to absolve their sins in the Nine Yin and dissolve the Seven Mysteries. On the days of *Lichun* and the Spring Equinox, light nine lamps in the central courtyard; on *Lixia* and the Summer Solstice, light three lamps; on *Liqiu* and the Autumn Equinox, light seven lamps; on *Lidong* and the Winter Solstice, light five lamps; and on their life-destiny day, light twelve lamps. At midnight, place the lamps outdoors, facing east on *Lichun* and the Spring Equinox, south on *Lixia* and the Summer Solstice, west on *Liqiu* and the Autumn Equinox, north on *Lidong* and the Winter Solstice, and toward the Year Star on their life-destiny day. Knock their teeth twenty-four times and softly recite the incantation:

*Supreme and Most True, Ten Thousand Sage Thearchs,
Five Thearchs and Jade Controllers, Overseers of All Immortals,
On this auspicious day of the eight solar terms,
We declare the dissolution of yang sins and yin punishments,
Sever the Nine Yin, forever absolve the Seven Mysteries,
Escape the fiery realms, forever leave the Mountain of Knives,
The Three Wretched Realms and Five Sufferings shall not burden my form.
May I be as enduring as Heaven and Earth, forever safeguarded by the Imperial Dawn.
May the Five Vows and Eight Assemblies be fulfilled as spoken.*

Upon completion, remove their headscarf, bow their head one hundred twenty times, touching their forehead to the ground without causing pain. Then, replace the headscarf, gaze upward, and silently recite: *“Today, my form receives the grace of Heaven’s favor, bestowed upon my mortal frame, to be reborn as a flying immortal.”* Conclude by swallowing twenty-four breaths of qi. After three years of such practice, all past transgressions shall be eradicated, their form shall become one with the Real, they shall not tread the Five Sufferings, escape the fiery realms, and attain the status of a true person, freely roaming their destined abode. This is a wondrous formula; guard it well and do not transmit it lightly.

The Four Poles are governed by the Four Directional and Five Thearch Jade Controller Lords, who universally oversee all realms—without height or depth, shallowness or profundity, and through boundless kalpas. None escape their comprehensive judgment of good and evil, for all fortunes and misfortunes are bound to the Jade Controller Lords.

The innumerable officials across the Four Directions and Eight Domains—are they not all designations of the Jade Controller and Wandering Controller Lords?

*Tai Xuan Upper Palace’s Nü Qing Four Poles Bright Statutes and Ordinances*

The Azure Thearch Jade Controller Lord, surnamed Liang, personal name Shu Du, wears a flying azure feathered robe adorned with nine-colored phoenix insignia, a Nine Primordial Treasure Crown upon his head, and holds a nine-colored staff. He governs the Eastern Grand Brightness Yang Terrace Grotto-Heaven, the August Mystery Capital’s Nü Qing Upper Palace, and commands the Eastern Marchmount Mount Tai’s officials, the earth spirits, water essences, and the Azure Armored Host. The Eastern Pole’s Boundless Metal-less Heaven, the innumerable kalpas, and the infinite, inexhaustible offices all fall under the jurisdiction of the Azure Thearch Jade Controller Lord. He presides over the life and death of beings; those who know his name and invoke his spirit through nine years of cultivation shall attain azure clouds and a flying canopy to welcome their destined form.

The *Tai Xuan Capital Four Poles Bright Statutes* state: Should the Supreme Jade Clarity Grand Perfected Thearch Emperor violate the statutes’ provisions, his name shall be stricken from the Imperial Register, and he shall be demoted to a Wandering Dispersed Perfected Thearch, governing the Great Clarity’s Central Palace for seven hundred years, with promotion contingent upon merit.

The *Tai Xuan Capital Four Poles Bright Statutes* state: Should an Upper Clarity Perfected Person neglect the affairs of the Thearch, slacken in duty, shirk their true office, or leak sacred formulas, bestowing them upon the unworthy, their name shall be stricken from the Register of Upper Perfected Ones, and they shall be demoted to serve as the Chief of the Five Marchmounts’ Hosts for a thousand years, with promotion contingent upon diligence.

The *Tai Xuan Capital Four Poles Bright Statutes* state: Should one who has received the title of Upper Prime Lady or the appellation of Primordial Lord neglect the affairs of the Thearch, shirk imperial duties, exceed proper decorum, disrupt courtly observances, or recklessly divulge celestial treasures, their name shall be stricken from the Register of Perfected Thearchs, their Purple Void rank revoked, and they shall be relegated to the Middle Mystery’s Qingwei Wandering Dispersed Spirit Officials for seven hundred years, with promotion contingent upon diligence.

The *Tai Xuan Capital Four Poles Bright Statutes* state: Should one who has received the title of Great Clarity Immortal neglect their office, delay imperial affairs, shirk their true duties, or leak celestial statutes, transmitting them to the unworthy, their name shall be stricken from the Register of Perfected Immortals, and they shall be demoted to serve as the Chief of the Five Marchmounts’ Laborers for two thousand four hundred years, with promotion contingent upon diligence.

The *Tai Xuan Capital Four Poles Bright Statutes* state: Should one who has received the title of Flying Immortal of the Five Marchmounts fail in their imperial duties, shirk their immortal office, or show contempt for the Dao’s texts, their name shall be stricken from the Register of Orthodox Immortals, and they shall be demoted to serve as the Chief of the Three Offices’ Hosts for two thousand four hundred years, with promotion contingent upon diligence.

The *Tai Xuan Capital Four Poles Bright Statutes* state: Should any who hold the positions of the Five Thearchs’ Four Controllers, Three Offices’ Chiefs, or Hosts of the Offices neglect their proper duties, delay or neglect their tasks, disregard celestial statutes, abandon imperial affairs, impose unjust punishments, provoke grievances from spirits, or act with reckless impropriety, their orthodox and true ranks shall be revoked, and they shall be demoted to serve as Clerks of the Hosts’ Command for three thousand six hundred years, with promotion contingent upon diligence.

The *Tai Xuan Capital Four Poles Bright Statutes* state: Should any who hold the Jade Tablets of the Upper Perfected—whether Gatekeepers, Jade Lords, Feathered Immortal Attendants, Upper Palace Ordinance Chiefs, Jade Perfected Immortal Leaders, Attendant Lords, Chief Prohibition Officers, Ordinance Immortal Feathered Youths, or Hosts of the Offices—neglect their duties, delay imperial affairs, or disregard celestial statutes, their Jade Tablets of the Upper Perfected shall be revoked, and they shall be demoted to serve as Clerks of the Three Offices, commanding wayward spirits for seven thousand years, with promotion contingent upon merit.

The *Tai Xuan Capital Four Poles Bright Statutes* state: The Yellow Writ and Red Realm, the Dao of True Unity—these minor arts of union and the secret matters of the Dao’s hands are subtly perilous. They involve the convergence and separation of the Two Images, the harmonization of the Three Qi, the resolution of turbid calamities, the dissolution of misfortune, the refinement of essence to nourish the spirit, and the attainment of deathlessness. Those who receive these methods yet harm the orthodox qi, indulge in desire, act with impurity and excess, harbor jealousy and doubt, attack their masters, or engage in slander face the gravest prohibitions. Should one violate these prohibitions, both they and their seven ancestors shall jointly endure the punishments of the Left and Right Palaces: treading mountains of fire, bearing stones to fill rivers, and suffering the Three Paths and Five Sufferings through three trials before being consigned to eternal servitude as ghostly laborers.

The Upper Palace *Nüqing* Precepts—those who receive them must observe them with clarity and caution.

The *Mingke* of the Four Poles of the Great Mystery Capital states: The great characters of the Upper Clarity Heavenly Sovereign, Earthly Sovereign, and Human Sovereign all encompass wondrous and subtle methods of profound emptiness, the treasured texts of the Cavernous Origin, and writings of numinous power. From the absence of a golden name in the Square Tablets of the Azure Palace, none may know or hear of them. Those who possess these texts shall immediately become earthly immortals, ascend to the mysterious void, and attain the rank of immortal ministers. Yet should they treat the celestial perfected with disdain, divulge the sacred treasures, transmit them to the unworthy, defile them with impurity, or fail in reverence to reveal them, violating these prohibitions, their seven ancestors shall undergo interrogation and be consigned to the Right Palace, enduring the trials of treading fire mountains, bearing stones to fill rivers, and suffering the Three Paths and Five Sufferings through one ordeal before being transformed into inhuman forms. Their own persons shall be consigned to the punishments of the Left Palace, treading fire mountains, enduring the Three Paths and Five Sufferings through three ordeals, and thereafter serving eternally as ghostly laborers.

The Upper Palace *Nüqing* Precepts of the Northern Emperor—those who receive them must observe them with clarity and caution.

The *Mingke* of the Four Poles of the Great Mystery Capital states: The *Cavernous Mystery Numinous Treasure Upper Scriptures*, the great and minor kalpas, the Five Talismans, the Jade Instructions, the treasured texts of Upper Clarity, and the Dao of the Mysterious Cavern—from the absence of jade bones and the mysterious chart, or a name inscribed in purple characters, none may see or hear of them. Those who possess these texts shall have jade lads and jade maidens attend them. They must burn incense and prostrate themselves as if serving a sovereign father, purify themselves in fasting and recite the scriptures, thereby ascending upon cloud chariots, feasting in the radiance of the Five Marchmounts, and presiding over the numinous mountains. Yet should they fail in reverence, defile and disdain the true texts, recklessly reveal and disseminate them, or transmit them to the unworthy, violating these prohibitions, their seven ancestors shall be interrogated and consigned to the Right Palace, enduring the trials of the Lesser Fire Mountain, the Three Paths, and the Five Sufferings through two ordeals before being reborn into inhuman forms. Their own persons shall be consigned to the interrogations of the Left Palace, enduring the punishments of treading fire mountains, bearing stones to fill rivers, and suffering the Three Paths and Five Sufferings through three ordeals before serving eternally as ghostly laborers in the boundless darkness of the netherworld.

The Upper Palace *Nüqing* Precepts of the Northern Emperor—those who receive them must observe them with clarity and caution.

The *Mingke* of the Four Poles of the Great Mystery Capital states: The thirty-nine chapters of the *Highest Cavernous Perfected Scripture*, the *Subtle and Numinous Great Possession Scripture*, the *Jade Tallies of the Feminine One and the Five Elders*, the *Purple Writings of the Golden Flower Cavern Chamber*, the *Original Register of Mount Tortoise*, the *Golden Root Upper Scripture of the Azure Register and White Tablet*, and the *Jade Chapters of the Great Empyrean*—these thirty-one volumes of the Upper Palace’s treasured texts are the independent instructions of the Dao of the Radiant Jade Mystery. The treasured texts of the Cavernous Heaven and Jade Clarity are conferred upon those who have already become perfected persons, possessing golden bones and jade viscera, their names inscribed on the imperial tablets and recorded in the Purple Court, thereby gaining access to these writings. Those who receive them shall have jade lads and jade maidens attend them; they must burn incense at their sides, prostrate themselves morning and evening as if serving a sovereign father, maintain perpetual fasting in the mysterious peaks, and recite the numinous chapters, thereby immediately summoning cloud chariots, ascending to Jade Clarity, attaining the golden gates, and sharing the same carriage as the Emperor. Yet should they receive these texts without reverence, violate the precepts through negligence, disbelieve in the celestial perfected, recklessly divulge the sacred instructions, or reveal the holy texts to the world, causing them to be seen and heard, they shall be reported by the jade lads, and their seven generations of ancestors shall be interrogated and consigned to the Right Palace, enduring the punishments of the Fire Mountain and the Three Paths, suffering the Five Sufferings through two ordeals before being reborn into inhuman forms. The jade lads and maidens shall return the scripture to the Upper Palace. The *Lüwen* of the Left and Right Female Azure of the Mysterious Capital must be reverently observed by the recipient.

The *Mingke* of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital states: The *Central Scripture of the Nine Perfected*, cultivated by the Celestial Emperor of the Great Subtle Heaven, was bound by the Eight Dao and Nine Perfected with luminous radiance, ascending the Dao of the sun and moon. If one bears the Azure Writ and Bundle of Flowers, or the Jade Characters of the Upper Clarity, and is a person of the Purple Net of Life, they may receive three transmissions within seven hundred years. The covenant requires ninety feet of white silk, one catty of azure silk thread, twenty-four feet of crimson silk (the oath of the sun’s radiance), twenty-four feet of jade-green silk (the oath of the moon’s essence), and three pairs of gold rings (the token of the Perpetual Lad). After ninety days of fasting, with an additional twenty-four days, one faces north to swear the covenant and transmit it. Seventeen jade lads and maidens each shall be assigned. This method is especially weighty: two offenses shall nullify all merit and sever one’s affairs; four offenses shall extend to the seven ancestors and oneself, all subjected to the examination of the Left and Right Bureaus, punished with the Knife Mountain and fire hells, consigned to the Three Paths and Five Sufferings for ten thousand kalpas, and reborn into the realm of the inhuman. The *Lüwen* of the Left Female Azure of the Mysterious Capital must be reverently observed by the recipient.

The *Mingke* of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital states: The *Hidden Scripture of the Great Cinnabar and Cavernous Perfection*, also called the *Seven Transformations and Nine Forms of the Celestial Lord*, the *Three Degrees of the Great One and Five Essences of the Imperial Treasure*, and the *Three-Five Union of the Imperial One*, was received by the Celestial Lord of the Great One from the chapters of the Empty Mystery’s spontaneity. The *Lüwen* of the Left Female Azure of the Mysterious Capital must be reverently observed by the recipient.

Twenty-four jade lads and thirty-six jade maidens shall be assigned to burn incense and attend the perfected. Only after three trials may they pass, condemned to labor eternally as lower ghosts, bearing stones to fill the rivers. The *Lüwen* of the Left Female Azure of the Mysterious Capital must be reverently observed by the recipient.

To the Jade Lads and Jade Maidens, twenty-one each, they attend and burn incense. Only after three examinations may one pass, then consigned eternally to the labor of bearing stones to fill the rivers. The Green Statutes of the Left Bureau of the Mysterious Capital—let the recipient observe with utmost care.

Thus shall the perfected descend to the chamber, the spirit be clear, the body luminous, and the attainment of immortality assured. To delay the spirits or violate the statutes—five transgressions shall sever merit and obstruct affairs, barring one from attaining immortality. Ten transgressions shall consign one to the hells—among the Three Wretched Paths—for ten thousand kalpas, returning only to the labor of the lowest ghosts.

*Statutes of the Azure Maiden of the Right Palace of the Mysterious Capital—let the recipient observe with clarity and caution.*

The *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* state: All implements for the veneration of the precious scriptures—tables, cloths, curtains, and canopies—must not be recklessly lent to others. Jade maidens and jade lads oversee and record these items; they may not be treated with negligence. Five transgressions shall sever merit and obstruct affairs, barring one from attaining immortality. Ten transgressions shall subject the body to scrutiny, and upon death, to the hells—among the Three Wretched Paths—for ten thousand kalpas, returning only to be reborn among the lowly.

*Statutes of the Azure Maiden of the Right Palace of the Mysterious Capital—let the recipient observe with clarity and caution.*

*Scroll Four of the* Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Jade Emperor of the Great Perfected *concludes here.*

*Scroll Five of the* Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Jade Emperor of the Great Perfected
*Statutes of the Azure Maiden of the Central Palace of the Great Mysterious Capital*

The Jade Controller of the Central Yellow Emperor, surnamed Huang, personal name Zongsheng, wears a robe of yellow patterns adorned with the nine colors, and a *Tongtian Yubao Chen* crown upon his head. He governs the Central Palace of the Great Mysterious Capital, presiding over the realm beyond above and below, within and without, front and back, the boundless kalpas, and the limitless heavens. He commands the immortal officials of the Central Songgao Mountain and oversees the troops of the Five Directions’ wu and ji. All officials of the Four Controllers are subordinate to the Jade Controller. He governs the life and death of humanity; knowing his name and visualizing his spirit, and cultivating for nine years, one shall be received by a chariot of yellow mist and ascend to heaven in broad daylight.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* state: Those possessing golden bones and jade names, inscribed in the Azure Palace, who encounter a scripture master in the world and receive the thirty-one fascicles of the *Independent Oral Instructions of the Precious Texts*, yet remain unable to renounce worldly ties and retreat to secluded mountains—constrained by worldly affairs, or lacking the resources for immortality—may still venerate and pay homage morning and evening, as one would serve a sovereign or father. Even those with spouses may cultivate the Dao of the Seven Scriptures, aligning their qi and observing the celestial measures. However, they must not disrupt the celestial balance, causing qi to scatter and spirits to depart, thereby entangling the true and perfected. The supreme perfected, the imperial effulgences, and the descendants of the Lordless Lady may descend to those of the Dao, forming celestial unions, their qi harmonizing in accordance with the cycles of destiny. How could this be sullied by the turbid and impure? Having received the supreme method yet remaining bound to the worldly path, one must seek the Seven Scriptures, follow their rites, and refrain from recklessly uniting yin and yang or defiling oneself without restraint. Should such acts occur, violating the purity of the retreat chamber—one transgression shall utterly bar one from immortality. Three transgressions shall subject oneself, the seven ancestors, and parents to the scrutiny of the Three Officials, punished with the Knife Mountain and Fire Feast, the Twenty-Four Hells, and the Three Wretched Paths and Five Sufferings for ten thousand kalpas, forever consigned to the labor of the lowest ghosts bearing stones.

The *Statutes of the Jade Maiden of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* must be received with clarity, caution, and diligent observance.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* state: Those who study the supreme teachings and receive the precious scriptures, after approaching their master and pledging their oath, must serve and honor their master with reverence, as though attending upon the divine. When entering the chamber to burn incense, they shall first visualize the master’s presence, bow in their heart before the master, and only then proceed with the rites. The covenants of sworn oaths and the pledges of bound sashes are of utmost gravity—never to be treated lightly. Should one violate the oath or betray the pledge, assail the master’s foundation, dispute right and wrong, or forsake the old for the new, a single transgression shall sever merit and nullify all progress, barring one from immortality. Three transgressions shall extend to the seven ancestors and oneself, subjecting all to the scrutiny of the Left and Right Officials, punished with the Knife Mountain and Fire Feast, the Twenty-Four Hells, and the Three Wretched Paths and Five Sufferings for ten thousand kalpas, forever consigned to the labor of the lowest ghosts bearing stones to fill the rivers.

The *Statutes of the Jade Maiden of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* must be received with clarity, caution, and diligent observance.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* state: Those who receive the supreme scriptures, approach their master, and ascend to pledge their oath, invoking the Nine Heavens above and swearing before the Ten Thousand Spirits below, vow to treasure, guard, and cultivate the Dao in secrecy. After the oath is sealed, one must not engage in frivolous speech or deceit, cheat fellow disciples, lure away scriptures, slander the master, fabricate baseless accusations, or recklessly reveal sacred secrets. To do so and share them with the uninitiated shall extend the sin to the seven ancestors, condemning them to boundless kalpas, treading the Knife Mountain and Fire Feast, enduring the Three Wretched Paths and Five Sufferings. In this life, one’s body shall be subjected to the torment of wind and blades, denied even the mercy of death. The sinful soul shall be consigned to the Left Official, the Knife Mountain and Fire Realm, the Twenty-Four Hells, and the Three Wretched Paths and Five Sufferings, with no hope of redemption for countless kalpas.

The *Statutes of the Jade Maiden of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* must be received with clarity, caution, and diligent observance.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* state: Those who bear the golden name of the Eastern Palace or the purple writ of the Jade Purity, having received the precious scriptures, must transmit them in accordance with the ordained covenants. Only when one has verified that the recipient’s bone constitution aligns with immortality, their precepts are flawlessly cultivated, and their intent is fixed upon attaining the true Dao, may one then perform the purification rites, administer the oath, and transmit the teachings. Should the disciple betray their vow after transmission, the sin shall extend to the master. Three transgressions shall nullify merit and sever all progress, barring one from immortality. Five transgressions shall condemn one to death and descent into hell, suffering in the Three Wretched Paths for ten thousand kalpas, only to be reborn into the lowest of mortal paths.

The *Statutes of the Jade Maiden of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* must be received with clarity, caution, and diligent observance.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* state: When men and women study together the Dao of the Supreme Purity, jointly serving the master, entering the chamber to fast and burn incense, and bowing in reverence, they shall proceed according to the depth of their learning, ascending in proper order. The most profound and discerning shall first receive the Three Treasures and the wondrous scriptures. Ascending the oath is of paramount importance; those of equal virtue shall be ranked by seniority. If both virtue and seniority are equal, the elder shall take precedence. All shall be judged by the loftiness of their virtue and the excellence of their talent, and the foremost among them shall be named the Master of the Great Cavern. None shall contend for precedence, refuse mutual respect, or disrupt the proper order, lest they be seized by the Four Administrations. Five transgressions shall nullify merit and sever all progress, barring one from immortality. Ten transgressions shall subject one to the scrutiny of the Left Official, condemning one to death and descent into hell, suffering in the Three Wretched Paths and Five Sufferings for ten thousand kalpas, only to be reborn into the lowest of mortal paths.

The *Statutes of the Jade Maiden of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* must be received with clarity, caution, and diligent observance.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* state: Those who jointly serve the master and pledge the same oath must ensure their hearts and minds are harmonious, their qi and voices in accord, and their conduct unified, advancing together in equal measure. Each shall strive for the other’s attainment of the true Dao, that all may receive the master’s scriptures and ascend to heaven in broad daylight. None shall assail one another, disrupt the harmony of fellow disciples, engage in clamorous disputes, or spread groundless slander. Though bound by the same oath, if their demeanor betrays discord, if they envy those more capable, or vie for precedence, they shall become adversaries. Such enemies of enmity shall be seized by the Four Administrations.

Three violations of these precepts shall sever one’s merit and obstruct attainment, barring rebirth as an immortal. Five violations shall bring examination by the Left Bureau, punishment by blade-mountain, fire-consumption, and charcoal-devouring, confinement in the Twenty-Four Hells, and suffering in the Three Paths and Five Torments for ten thousand kalpas without reprieve.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Azure Writs of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* state: Those who approach a scripture-master to pledge oaths and receive the *Thirty-Nine Chapters of the Supreme Clarity Treasure Scripture* and the *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles* shall, on the eight seasonal nodes, present a pair of gold rings and nine feet of azure silk to the scripture-master. The master, upon receiving these tokens, shall inscribe in sequence the names, native prefectures, counties, townships, ages, birth months, and years of all disciples on the center of the nine-foot azure silk. At the sheer cliffs of the Mysterious Peak, facing north, he shall submit the names to the Azure Palace, knock his teeth twenty-four times, and softly intone the incantation:

*"The heavens revolve, the qi retreats,
The Eight Paths convey their essence,
The Three and Five meet their destined hour,
The Nine Blessings shift in turn.
The root-truth abides in mysterious quiescence,
Assisting the imperial spirits of the throne.
The jade tablets have been presented;
Now I submit the names of the pledged.
Solemnly I notify the Nine Bureaus,
The numinous overseers of the Five Peaks,
To record those I have listed,
That they may ascend to the Jade Clarity.
After three years,
Come to welcome my embodied form,
Bestow the Eight Radiant Chariots,
And ascend to the Celestial Court of the Supreme Emperor."*

When finished, he shall bury the azure silk beneath the sheer cliff. Thus for three years, a perfected one shall descend to instruct the disciple in the Way of spirit and truth. Those who receive the regulations but fail to submit their names shall have no record in the Azure Palace; if seized by the Four Administrations, they shall incur the same penalty as those who steal scriptures or pilfer regulations. Should the master ascend as an immortal or reside too far to deliver the rings and silk, disciples shall perform the rite themselves. They must still pledge their tokens as a sign of devotion to the master, though they need not send them to the scripture-master. To miss one seasonal offering shall nullify merit and obstruct attainment, barring rebirth as an immortal. Three missed offerings shall invoke a decree from the Three Bureaus, punishment by wind-blades, and death in the hells. They shall endure the torments of the Three Paths for ten thousand kalpas and be reborn in the realm of non-humans. If the master receives the pledged tokens but fails to submit them, the penalty shall be the same.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Azure Writs of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* state: Those who cultivate the Supreme Dao shall pacify the heart and still the mind, guard the truth in silence, and maintain mindfulness in all actions, treating the Dao as their very body. Through fasting, precepts, and adherence to the regulations, they shall calculate their days until attaining immortality. They must not indulge in anger, resentment, or vexation, nor harbor grudges, curse, or invoke ghosts and spirits, lest they offend the celestial statutes and bring calamity upon themselves and the examining officials. Three violations of this prohibition shall forever bar attainment of immortality; five violations shall extend punishment to the seven generations above and the self below, consigning all to the blade-mountain, fire-consumption, and charcoal-devouring hells, suffering in the Three Paths and Five Torments for ten thousand kalpas, and rebirth in the realm of non-humans.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Azure Writs of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* state: Those who cultivate the Way of Supreme Clarity shall hold in their hearts all creatures—winged, crawling, born, and unborn—wishing that all attain the true Dao, achieve immortality, and that heaven’s grace be universally bestowed. When merit is complete and virtue perfected, they shall calculate their days until attaining immortality. They must not harbor thoughts of rebellion, nor harm living beings with their hands. If others surpass them, they must not wish them peril or downfall, nor prioritize malice over goodness. This prohibition is especially grave; violations shall bind them to the Left Bureau, subject their bodies to wind-blades, and extend punishment to their seven generations, all enduring the torments of blade-mountains, fire-consumption, and charcoal-devouring in the Three Paths and Twenty-Four Hells for countless kalpas without reprieve.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Azure Writs of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* state: Those who cultivate the Way of Supreme Clarity shall ensure their five viscera and six bowels are pure, their inner and outer elixirs harmonized, their upper and lower essences aligned, their precious flowers interwoven, and their spirits radiant and luminous. They must not consume alcohol, lest drunkenness disrupt their organs, startle their five spirits, defile their aspirations, and prevent the completion of their practice, inviting inner illness to ravage their bodies and hasten their decay. Such cultivation is a vain labor of the heart. Five violations of this regulation shall bar rebirth as an immortal; ten violations shall extend punishment to the seven generations above and the self below, consigning all to the blade-mountain hells for ten thousand kalpas before rebirth among humans.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Azure Writs of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* state: Those who receive the *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles* and the true methods of the Three Heavens, and wear the true writs, shall always prioritize bathing and washing. They must keep their footwear, clothing, and garments immaculate, avoiding filth lest the true spirits depart and malevolent forces take advantage. Five violations shall result in the revocation of their rank among the terrestrial immortals; ten violations shall bring examination by the Left Bureau, death in the hells for ten thousand kalpas, and rebirth in the realm of non-humans.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Azure Writs of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* state: Disciples of the Supreme Way who receive the true methods of the Three Heavens and the *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles* must not recklessly enter defiled or polluted places, nor weep sorrowful tears or offer condolences at funerals. Five violations shall sever merit and obstruct attainment, barring rebirth as an immortal; ten violations shall result in death in the hells for ten thousand kalpas and rebirth in the realm of non-humans.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Azure Writs of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* state: Disciples of the Supreme Way who receive the true methods of the Three Heavens and the *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles*, and wear the true writs, must not, when going out beneath the Three Luminaries or when sleeping, sitting, or resting, expose their heads without a kerchief or hat, nor remove their clothing to bare their forms, thereby insulting their body-spirits and dishonoring the true writs, causing the true spirits to depart and leaving only an empty corpse. Three violations shall bar rebirth as an immortal; five violations shall result in death in the hells for ten thousand kalpas and rebirth in the realm of non-humans.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Azure Writs of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* state: Those who receive these precepts shall observe them with clarity and caution.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* state: All advanced scholars who receive the true methods of the Three Heavens and the *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles* must not recklessly share beds, seats, or rising positions with those of the yin household, nor with those whose external qi does not align with the Dao. They must not share clothing, blankets, footwear, or other items in mutual exchange. Five violations shall bar rebirth as an immortal; ten violations shall result in death in the hells, suffering the Three Paths and Five Torments for ten thousand kalpas, and rebirth in the realm of non-humans. The *Luminous Regulations of the Azure Writs of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* state: Those who receive these precepts shall observe them with clarity and caution.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* state: All who cultivate the methods of the Highest Clarity must not face north toward their life-destiny’s position, nor relieve themselves in two places, lest they offend the Jade Morning of their nature and defile their original true essence. Five violations shall bar rebirth as an immortal; ten violations shall subject them to interrogation by the Left Bureau, death in the hells, and suffering in the Three Paths for ten thousand kalpas, followed by rebirth in the realm of non-humans. The *Luminous Regulations of the Azure Writs of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* state: Those who receive these precepts shall observe them with clarity and caution.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* state: All who receive the precious scriptures of the Highest Clarity and cultivate the Way of the Solar and Lunar Imperial Flowers must, during solar and lunar eclipses and on the days of new and full moons—when celestial qi wages assault and the two luminaries engage in battle—adhere to the purple writs’ methods to defend and rescue them. Without these methods, one must not cultivate the Way of the Sun and Moon or practice the arts of chewing the solar root. Those who recklessly violate this prohibition shall be barred from rebirth as an immortal; five violations shall subject them to interrogation by the Left Bureau, death in the hells, and suffering in the Three Paths and Five Torments for ten thousand kalpas, followed by rebirth in the realm of non-humans. The *Luminous Regulations of the Azure Writs of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* state: Those who receive these precepts shall observe them with clarity and caution.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* state: All who receive the precious scriptures of the Jade Clarity must first perform a declaration of purification and transmit them in accordance with the day’s covenant. If the covenant has not yet been established, one must still perform the declaration of purification before initiating the scripture, and upon its completion, perform the covenant to transmit it. To transmit the scripture without a covenant shall subject both master and recipient to interrogation by the Left and Right Bureaus, extending to seven generations of ancestors and the recipient’s own person, condemning them to the Knife Mountains and Fire Realms, the Twenty-Four Hells, and the Three Paths and Five Torments, where they shall endure three interrogations before being reborn as lower ghosts burdened with the labor of bearing stones. The *Luminous Regulations of the Azure Writs of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* state: Those who receive these precepts shall observe them with clarity and caution.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* state: The precious scriptures of the Highest Clarity bear the heaviest prohibitions. In ancient times, they were revealed but once in ten thousand kalpas. In this degenerate age, few seek the Dao, and the Three Heavens hasten their destiny, requiring worthy ones to assist in rectification. Thus, a limit of seven hundred years is set, and they are transmitted only when the right person is encountered. If one whose bones are destined to receive the scriptures has not yet completed the seven hundred years, their name in the Azure Register and their status in the Mysterious Record remain undetermined, and they must not presume to act as a scripture master. Though they may possess jade bones and a golden storehouse, they must not recklessly transmit the scriptures. The Most High regularly dispatches officials from the Three Bureaus and the Four Divisions of Inspectors to traverse the world. Those who violate the prohibitions by leaking the scriptures shall be reported to the Azure Writs, and their seven generations of ancestors shall be seized and consigned to the Cauldron of Boiling Water in the Fire Realm. After one interrogation, their souls shall be emaciated, and they shall tread the Knife Mountains for ten thousand kalpas before being burdened with the labor of bearing stones. Their own person and those who lightly received the scriptures shall together endure the torments of the Wind and Knife in this world, suffering the punishment of being unable to die. After interrogation, they shall endure the trials of the Knife Mountains and Fire Realms, the Twenty-Four Hells, and the Three Paths and Five Torments for ten thousand kalpas before being assigned the labor of bearing stones. The *Luminous Regulations of the Azure Writs of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* state: Those who receive these precepts shall observe them with clarity and caution.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* state: All who receive the precious scriptures of the Highest Clarity, though their allotted years have not yet expired, must, upon encountering one with golden bones and a jade storehouse—a person destined for immortality—who seeks these scriptures, transmit them to such a one through a master who knows the methods in advance. They must not obstruct the seeker’s path on the grounds that they themselves have not yet transmitted them. If one guides and transmits to three persons who are destined for the true, their merit shall move Heaven, and the Jade Emperor shall issue a special decree to the Four Bureaus to erase their names from the records of transgressions. Those who violate these prohibitions shall, upon the first violation, be barred from rebirth as an immortal; three violations shall result in death in the hells, suffering in the Three Paths and Five Torments for ten thousand kalpas, and the labor of bearing stones. The *Luminous Regulations of the Azure Writs of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* state: Those who receive these precepts shall observe them with clarity and caution.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* state: All who receive the precious scriptures of the Highest Clarity must prepare a pledge, swearing with their heart and offering treasure to the Dao, commensurate with the oath of cutting hair and drawing blood. To receive the scriptures without a pledge is to transgress the celestial Way; to transmit the scriptures without a covenant is to leak the celestial treasure. Both transmitter and recipient must be cautious of their obligations. One violation shall bar rebirth as an immortal; three violations shall condemn seven generations of ancestors and the recipient’s own person to the Knife Mountains and Fire Realms, the Twenty-Four Hells, and the Three Paths for ten thousand kalpas before being assigned the labor of bearing stones. The *Luminous Regulations of the Azure Writs of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* state: Those who receive these precepts shall observe them with clarity and caution.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* state: All who transmit the precious scriptures of the Highest Clarity and receive tokens of trust from their disciples shall divide them into three parts: one part to be cast among mountain recluses to relieve the destitute and impoverished scholars; one part to provide for their own ritual garments; and one part to establish merit for the disciple’s seven generations of ancestors, purchasing incense, oil, and the like. Thus, the three parts unite as one, and the Dao becomes luminous. On the day the offering is cast among mountain recluses, one must vow that all destitute and impoverished scholars in the world who cultivate in seclusion and endure hardship shall swiftly attain the Dao, transcend the world, ascend as immortals, escape poverty, and surmount the Eight Difficulties. On the day one dons one’s ritual garments and cap, one must vow that one’s own person shall share the same attire and cap as the Emperor, wearing the garments of the imperial law. When lighting lamps and burning incense in accordance with the imperial law, one must vow that the disciple, one’s own person, seven generations of ancestors, and parents shall escape the Knife Mountains and the hells of the Three Paths and Five Torments, ascend to the Southern Palace, return to the womb to be reborn as immortals, and in all matters follow the law to attain the true Dao. Those who violate the covenant and transgress the regulations shall be interrogated, extending to their own person and seven generations of ancestors, who shall be eternally confined in the Dark Springs, their persons enduring the Five Difficulties, and never be pardoned for ten thousand kalpas. The *Luminous Regulations of the Azure Writs of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* state: Those who receive these precepts shall observe them with clarity and caution.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mystery Capital* state: All who receive the precious scriptures of the Highest Clarity, presenting their tokens of faith to their masters, must not, before fulfilling the prescribed term, accept other tokens for their own use after receiving the scriptures. Rather, they shall transmit them to their former masters, ensuring the prior term is fully met, before dispersing one-third of the remainder. Those who violate the regulations and transgress the laws shall be interrogated by the Left Bureau, their merits nullified with each offense, and they shall not attain immortality. Upon a third offense, the punishment extends to their seven generations of ancestors and their own person, who shall be consigned to the Knife Mountains and the fiery realms, the Twenty-Four Hells, and the Three Paths for ten thousand kalpas, thereafter reduced to the labor of lowly ghosts.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Azure Writs of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* state: Those who receive these precepts shall observe them with clarity and caution.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mystery Capital* state: All who serve as scripture masters, transmitting the tokens of the Heavenly Treasures, yet disperse only one-third while privately diverting the rest for other uses, leaving the destitute without succor and the seven generations of ancestors without deliverance from sin, and themselves without pure and undefiled vestments—such persons offend the gods and transgress the law. Upon a third offense, they shall not attain immortality; upon a fifth, they shall die and enter hell, suffering in the Three Paths for ten thousand kalpas before being reborn into the human realm.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Azure Writs of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* state: Those who receive these precepts shall observe them with clarity and caution.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mystery Capital* state: All who study the Dao of the Highest Clarity must constantly wear the ritual sash and talismans, devoting themselves to fasting, abstinence, and tranquil contemplation. They shall not wander in idle gatherings, lodge in common households, or frequently engage in quarrels, disputes, or conflicts with ordinary companions, nor harbor resentment, invoke heaven and earth, or offend the gods and violate the prohibitions. Upon a third offense, their prior merits shall be nullified, and they shall not attain immortality; upon a fifth, they shall die and enter hell, suffering for ten thousand kalpas before being reduced to the labor of lowly ghosts, bearing stones to fill the rivers.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Azure Writs of the Central Palace* state: Those who receive these precepts shall observe them with clarity and caution.

The *One Hundred and Twenty Precepts of the Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mystery Azure Writs of the Highest Sage* assist in the governance of the Three and Five, aiding the Great Clarity. Above, they encompass the myriad perfected beings; below, they govern the hidden spirits. They rectify and regulate qi, supervise and command the immortals, with the Four Directors and Five Emperors distinguishing life and death. They are the profound statutes of the Supreme Deity and the majestic luminosity of the Jade Emperor. Concealed within the Palace of Great Abundance above the Nine Heavens, they have endured through countless kalpas, never circulated in the world. When the cycles of fortune and misfortune intersect, they shall be transmitted to those of mysterious name, jade bones, and golden viscera, the purple-scripted adepts of the Highest Clarity, those destined for immortality.

Those who obtain these regulations shall have their names reported by the Four Directors, universally proclaimed to the Five Marchmounts, the Three Rivers, the Nine Springs, and the Four Poles’ spirit officials. Guardians shall protect their forms, perfected beings descend, and the Three Primes visit their chambers, where radiant light arises, their bodies suffused with golden perfection. This is the wondrous transformation—immortality attained without study. For those who study the Highest Dao, these regulations come first. With diligent effort and arduous practice, seeking remote mountains, their sincere devotion moves the unseen, and they encounter these scriptures. Those who obtain them must treasure and conceal them, never showing them to others.

Such are the luminous regulations, upheld by the Heavenly Perfected Venerable of the Nine Heavens, the Celestial Venerable of Primordial Beginning, the Jade Maidens of the Great Perfection, the Jade Lads of the Three Heavens, the Jade Emperor of the Highest Sovereign, the Thirty-Nine Perfected, the Upper Prime of the Southern Pole, the Three Primes of the Great Simplicity, the Primordial Lady of Purple Simplicity, the Queen Mother of the Western Tortoise, the Lady of the Purple Tenuity, the Four Directors, the Five Emperors, the Perfected of the Four Poles, and the immortals of the Five Marchmounts—none fail to observe these regulations. Without them, the governance of the Emperor would not proceed, the royal canons would be deficient, and immortality would remain unattainable for students. Thus, they are the secrets of the Emperor and Sovereign, never circulated in the world. If their texts were to appear in the world, the land would no longer know those who mourn the dead.

Now, as the Three and Five cycles turn, the time has come for their transmission. Therefore, the Jade Emperor has dispatched the divine soldiers of the Five Directions and the Three Officials of the Left and Right to inspect and regulate the sacred texts, apprehend those who violate them, and investigate reckless transmissions, all in accordance with the mysterious regulations. For seven hundred years, those who encounter the true teachings and form covenants, practicing in accordance with the law, shall attain the highest immortality. Those who violate them shall be seized and interrogated—let no blame fall upon the sacred texts. Thus, these laws are established. Observe them with care and caution.

All advanced scholars who receive the precious scripture *The Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles* shall, on the Eight Festivals, the day of the Great Year-Star, and their own life-destiny day, ingest and wear the fifteen sacred talismans of the Supreme Perfected to dissolve the karmic knots of their destined forms and stellar transgressions, dispelling the trials of wind-blades, water, and fire, the Knife Mountains and Fire Realms, the Twenty-Four Hells, the Three Paths and Five Sufferings, and the punishment of bearing stones to fill rivers. By ingesting these talismans, they shall transcend the Eight Difficulties; the Jade Bureau shall erase their names and inscribe them in the Azure Palace. After nine years, the Perfected shall descend to their chambers, and they shall ride flying clouds to ascend the Nine Heavens.

All devoted scholars whose names are recorded on the Purple Registers, though they may not yet possess the great scriptures, may also singly ingest these talismans to dissolve their karmic roots, avert calamities, and extend their lives, gradually attaining the state of divine transcendence. On the day they receive them, they may form a single covenant, offering two taels of refined gold and forty feet of purple silk as a pledge to the Nine Heavens. They shall announce their vows with a full purification rite, kneel, and receive the talismans.
