When the adept wishes to summon the Lord of the Jade Bureau of the Azure Emperor, they shall, on the days of *Lichun* (Beginning of Spring) and *Chunfen* (Spring Equinox), inscribe in black upon blue paper, face east to ingest it, and also inscribe in black upon blue silk to wear for nine years. The Jade Bureau shall erase the adept’s death transgressions, transfer them to the Palace of Life, and dispatch green clouds and emerald chariots to welcome their body.

**Western Talisman of the Lesser Yin, the Luminous Communion of the True Jade**
When the adept wishes to summon the Lord of the Jade Bureau of the White Emperor, they shall, on the days of *Liqiu* (Beginning of Autumn) and *Qiufen* (Autumn Equinox), inscribe in yellow upon white paper, face west to ingest it, and also inscribe in yellow upon white silk to wear for nine years. The Jade Bureau shall erase the adept’s death transgressions, transfer them to the Palace of Life, and dispatch flying clouds and pristine chariots to welcome their body.

**Southern Talisman of the Great Yang, the Vermilion Radiance of the Cavern-Heaven of True Jade**
When the adept wishes to summon the Lord of the Jade Bureau of the Red Emperor of the Left Palace, they shall, on the days of *Lixia* (Beginning of Summer) and *Xiazhi* (Summer Solstice), inscribe in blue upon red paper, face south to ingest it, and also inscribe in blue upon crimson silk to wear for nine years. The Jade Bureau shall erase the adept’s death transgressions, transfer them to the Palace of Life, and dispatch vermilion clouds and scarlet chariots to descend and welcome their body.

**Northern Talisman of the Great Yin, the Mysterious Essence of True Jade**
When the adept wishes to summon the Lord of the Jade Bureau of the Black Emperor, they shall, on the days of *Lidong* (Beginning of Winter) and *Dongzhi* (Winter Solstice), inscribe in white upon black paper, face north to ingest it, and also inscribe in white upon black silk to wear for nine years. The Jade Bureau shall erase the adept’s death transgressions, transfer them to the Palace of Life, and dispatch dark clouds and green chariots to descend and welcome their body.

**Central Talisman of the Great Yellow, the Myriad Beginnings of True Jade**
When the adept wishes to summon the Lord of the Jade Bureau of the Yellow Emperor, they shall, on the day of the Great Year-Star and their own life-destiny day, face the direction of the Great Year-Star, inscribe in red upon yellow paper to ingest, and also inscribe in red upon yellow silk to wear for nine years. The Jade Bureau shall erase the adept’s death transgressions, transfer them to the Palace of Life, and dispatch yellow clouds and flying chariots to descend and welcome their body, ascending to the Palace of the Supreme Clarity.

*(Talisman text originally omitted)*
**Talisman of the Ninefold Transmutation of Gold Essence and Stone Marrow**
When the adept wishes to escape the trials of the Knife Mountains, they shall, on their life-destiny day, inscribe in white upon blue paper and ingest it for three years. Their karmic transgressions shall be dissolved, and the Perfected shall descend. After nine years, they shall ride dragons and traverse the void, soaring through the Great Empyrean.

*(Talisman text originally omitted)*
**Talisman of the Refined Form and Transformed Radiance of the Yang Essence**
When the adept wishes to escape the trials of the Fire Realms and the punishment of consuming coals, they shall, on their life-destiny day, inscribe in vermilion upon white paper and ingest it. After three years, their sins shall be eradicated from the Nine Yin, and the Jade Perfected of the Great Yang shall descend to their body. After nine years, they shall ride clouds and command dragons, soaring through the Purple Void.

*(Talisman text originally omitted)*
**Talisman of the Nine Rivers’ Mysterious Numinosity, the Dragon Script of Jade**
When the adept wishes to escape the labor of bearing stones to fill rivers, they shall, on their life-destiny day, inscribe in blue upon yellow paper and ingest it for three years. Their karmic roots shall be eradicated, and after nine years, the River Earl shall come forth to welcome them. They shall enter water without sinking, and though the abyss be ten thousand fathoms deep, they shall soar through the Azure Abyss—the Great Mystery of the Dao, transmitted only to the true.

*(Talisman text originally omitted)*
**Talisman of the Ninefold Mystery of the Pure Subtlety, the Cavern-Source of Divine Life**
When the adept wishes to avoid passing through the left and right bureaus of the Heaven of Pure Subtlety, they shall, on the third day of the lunar month and their life-destiny day, inscribe in blue upon white paper to ingest, and also inscribe in blue upon white silk to wear. The officials of the Heaven of Pure Subtlety shall descend to guard their body, and after nine years, they shall attain flying clouds to welcome their body.

*(Talisman text originally omitted)*
**Talisman of the Mysterious Essence of Yu-Yu, the Jade Talisman of Divine Protection**
When the adept wishes to avoid passing through the left and right bureaus of the Heaven of Yu-Yu, they shall, on the fifteenth day of the lunar month and their life-destiny day, inscribe in yellow upon blue paper to ingest, and also inscribe in yellow upon blue silk to wear. The officials of the Heaven of Yu-Yu shall descend to guard their form, and after nine years, they shall attain a canopy of yellow clouds and dark radiance to descend and welcome their body.

*(Talisman text originally omitted)*
**Talisman of the Vermilion Yang, the Cavern-Flame and Mysterious Essence of the Transformed Body**
When the adept wishes to avoid passing through the left and right bureaus of the Great Red Heaven, they shall, on the twenty-fifth day of the lunar month and their life-destiny day, inscribe in vermilion upon white paper to ingest, and also inscribe in vermilion upon white silk to wear. The officials of the Red Heaven shall descend to guard their body, and after nine years, they shall attain a flying chariot of cinnabar clouds to descend and welcome their body.

*(Talisman text originally omitted)*
**Talisman of the Primordial Beginning, the Heaven-Monitoring Jade Talisman for Deliverance from Difficulties and the Revivification of the Hun-Soul**
When the adept wishes to avoid passing through the Eight Prisons of Mount Fengdu and escape their torments, they shall, on the days of *Jiazi*, *Jiawu*, and their life-destiny day, inscribe in blue upon white paper to ingest, and also inscribe in blue upon white silk to wear. The Jade Bureau shall then exempt them, allowing them to transcend the Eight Difficulties and avoid prison torments. After nine years, the Perfected shall descend, and they shall ascend to heaven in broad daylight.

*(Talisman text originally omitted)*
**Talisman of the Central Mystery, the Spontaneous Numinous Talisman for Deliverance from Difficulties and Rebirth**
When the adept wishes to avoid passing through the Middle Eight Prisons of Mount Fengdu and escape their torments, they shall, on the days of *Jiayin*, *Jiashen*, and their life-destiny day, inscribe in yellow upon blue paper to ingest, and also inscribe in yellow upon blue silk to wear. The Five Emperors shall then exempt them, allowing them to transcend the Eight Difficulties and avoid prison torments. After nine years, the Perfected shall descend, and they shall ride flying clouds to ascend to heaven in broad daylight.

**(Talisman text originally omitted)**
**Talisman of the Three Qi for Generating the Body and Restoring the Hun-Soul**
When the adept wishes to avoid passing through the Eight Prisons beneath Mount Fengdu and escape the torments of hell, they shall, on the days of *Jiachen*, *Jiaxu*, and their life-destiny day, inscribe in vermilion upon yellow paper to ingest, and also inscribe in vermilion upon yellow silk to wear. The Five Emperors shall then exempt them, allowing them to transcend the Eight Difficulties and avoid prison torments. After nine years, they shall ride flying clouds to ascend to heaven in broad daylight.

**(Talisman text originally omitted)**
**Luminous Talisman of the Three Flowers for Returning the Spirit**
When the adept wishes to avoid the trials of wind-blades, water, fire, and the interrogations of the Left and Right Officials, they shall, on their life-destiny day and the day of the Grand Year-Star, inscribe in yellow upon white paper to ingest, and also inscribe in yellow upon silk to wear. The Four Luminaries shall then erase their transgressions, the Lady of Blue shall strike their name from the rolls, and the Jade Bureau shall submit their case for inscription among the Three Clarities. After three years, they shall converse with the Perfected; after seven years, they shall ascend in flight.

This Dao is profoundly subtle—guard it well and do not transmit it lightly.

The fifteen precious talismans of the Supreme Perfected are treasures of the Highest Sage, the Jade Emperor of Great Perfection. They are secretly preserved in the Crimson Chamber of the Seven Radiant Splendors, within the Jeweled Grove’s Purple Gate, attended and incensed by eight hundred jade-maidens of the Flowery Brilliance. These texts of primordial antiquity emerge but once in ten thousand kalpas; without one’s name inscribed in the Emperor’s Register of the Purple Script of the Jade Clarity, none may partake of their mysteries. The High Minister, the Blue Lad, seals one copy each in the Nine Heavens, where the Twenty-Four Emperors and Thirty-Nine Perfected preserve them through endless kalpas, their luster ever renewed despite eons of concealment.

Should one encounter these talismans, their destiny shall be marked for transcendence: they shall tread no path of the Three Wretched Realms, nor be bound by the Five Sufferings. They shall deliver the damned from hell, extricate themselves from the Eight Difficulties, disperse the sins of the Nine Yin, sever the roots of past karma, and liberate their seven ancestors, restoring their hun-souls to the Southern Terrace. Those who study without this method labor in vain; their trials remain unresolved, and with each misstep, they enter the gates of judgment, unable to exonerate themselves. Misfortune shall extend to their seven generations, and the sorrows of life and death shall be beyond words.

The adept who obtains these talismans shall attain transcendence without study; their trials shall vanish, and they shall ascend to the Dragon Chariot. Treasure them and practice accordingly to bear your body aloft—yet guard them closely and never display them to the profane, lest you incur heaven’s heavy burden and turn resentment against the Dao and the Perfected. All this accords with the statutes of the *Nüqing Lüwen* of the Mysterious Capital.

When transmitting or receiving these talismans, enter a chamber, burn incense, face east, and knock the teeth twenty-four times. Recite the incantation:
*"Supreme Jade Perfected, exalted sages of the Nine Mysteries,
Jade script binds my po, preserves my form, and anchors my spirit.
Thrice refined, nine times tested, my Dao is spontaneous.
Delivered from Fengdu, forever parted from the Mountain of Knives,
the Three Wretched Realms and Five Sufferings shall not constrain me.
I petition the Jade Bureau to inscribe my true name,
recorded in the Azure Register and Purple Scrolls of the Attained Dao.
The Three Origins align in splendor, the Nine Emperors share my chariot.
I grasp the Purple Void’s reins to ascend to the Dawn Court.
Blessings flow to my seven ancestors, all attaining transcendence."*

Conclude by swallowing the talisman and circulating saliva twenty-four times. If practiced according to this method for three years, the roots of misfortune shall dissolve, the Emperor Perfected shall descend, and with virtue fulfilled and the Dao accomplished, one shall attain divine transcendence.

For those who receive the Dao of the Supreme Clarity and cultivate its precious scriptures and jade talismans yet do not study the *Four Luminous Statutes of the Four Poles*, success shall forever elude them. Statutes restrain transgressions, and regulations expose faults; to study without the *Bright Statutes* is like a blind man groping toward light—unable to perceive the source, one cannot grasp the method. Missteps in practice lead to the realm of sin, where one’s seven ancestors are enslaved and one’s own body suffers calamity, drifting through the Three Wretched Realms and Five Sufferings for ten thousand kalpas without release, forever indebted to the River of Origins.

The adept who seeks learning must first master the *Statutes*; with the *Statutes* as guide, success comes without toil. Sweep the floor, burn incense, and reverently serve the divine. When faults arise, repent at once; light lamps in the central courtyard, ingest the true talismans, dissolve sins, and preserve your form. The Jade Emperor shall be moved, exempting your case. The Jade Bureau shall hold no record of your transgressions, and the Mysterious Capital shall bear no name for punishment. Heaven shall assign maidens to attend you, while the Supreme Tenuity bestows regalia upon your seven ancestors, and the Southern Palace restores their forms to higher transcendence. Diligently practice the wondrous Dao of the Supreme Perfected.

For those who embody the *Four Luminous Statutes of the Four Poles*, the Five Emperors of the Jade Bureau shall inscribe their names, submitting them to the Azure Palace of the Highest Sage. Above, the Supreme Emperor shall dispatch thirty-six Jade Lads of the Upper Numinous and twenty-four Jade Maidens of the Western Flower to guard the adept’s body, averting disasters, dispelling misfortunes, erasing sins, eliminating perils, rectifying faults, and rewarding merit, thereby connecting with the divine and attaining the Perfected. The adept shall burn incense and perform morning and evening rites, reciting the *Statutes* thrice monthly, always keeping them thoroughly familiar. Never treat the sacred texts with carelessness or defilement, nor violate the *Statutes* or transgress the precepts, lest the Jade Lads report them. The Left Officials shall then impose punishments equivalent to those in the *Nüqing Lüwen* and the *Four Poles Statutes*. Practitioners, be vigilant.

The *Four Luminous Statutes of the Four Poles* are the standards of the Jade Emperor of Great Perfection in the Supreme Palace, a text preserved for eons yet never transmitted. Thus, though students are as numerous as trees in a forest, only one in a thousand succeeds. Yet when one attains transcendence, it spans a thousand years. Were these *Statutes* widely known, none in the world would die. Therefore, the Jade Emperor guards them and does not transmit them below.

Should one obtain these *Statutes* and recklessly reveal their sacred texts to three others, their body shall perish, their form shall be maimed, and their seven ancestors shall be consigned to the Mountain of Knives. Scholars of the Dao, treasure these jade scrolls and await divine transcendence—never transmit them lightly.

When the great cycle turns and the precious scriptures are destined to circulate, once every seven hundred years, if one encounters a worthy recipient, they shall kneel and transmit them. When receiving the *Statutes*, present ninety feet each of five-colored brocade silk, forty feet of phoenix-patterned gauze, one gold fish, one jade dragon, and one jade tablet, twelve inches in length, inscribed with the year and month of transmission, to be sealed in the adept’s life-destiny mountain. Without this covenant, none may transmit them recklessly. To violate the covenant and betray the oath is to be judged by the Left Officials; master and disciple alike shall be consigned to ghostly servitude, bearing mountains and filling rivers for ten thousand kalpas without pardon.

When transmitting the *Statutes of the Four Poles*, one must fast and prepare a jade tablet, inscribing upon it: the year, month, and day of the new moon; the name of the adept of such-and-such a sacred peak; their age; their birth month; and their life-destiny governed by the Azure Emperor of the Eastern Dipper. Reverently, upon the lofty cliffs of the Dark Peak, they shall swear an oath to the Nine Heavens, receiving the *Statutes of the Four Poles* and vowing to uphold the true Dao. They beseech to have their name inscribed upon the Purple Registers and recorded in the Azure Palace. To violate the covenant and betray the oath is to forfeit all hope of immortality.

The master faces north, clicks their teeth twenty-four times, and invokes: To the High Numinous, Mysterious Void, Great King of the Nine Heavens, Radiant August Jade Emperor, the Thirty-Nine Perfected; to the Most High and Mysterious, the Lord of the Myriad Immortals; to the Inspecting Spirit Messengers, the Jade Lads in Attendance, the Four Directors and Five Emperors, and the Overseers of the Perfected and Immortals—now there is an aspiring Daoist, the adept of such-and-such a sacred peak, who seeks to inherit the supreme teachings and receive the precious scriptures, numbering so many scrolls. Yet, in this degenerate age, they have not yet ascended bodily; though their resolve reaches the Mysterious Void and they wander the sacred peaks, they remain indistinguishable from the worldly. Unacquainted with the *Statutes*, their conduct transgresses, offending the numinous heavens above.

Today, in accordance with the covenant, they present the pledged tokens, entrusting their fate and life, and seek to receive the precious instructions, numbering so many matters. The *Statutes of the Four Poles* must be upheld as the luminous text of the oath sworn to the Nine Heavens. They shall be vigilant, guard their speech, and cultivate the preservation of spirit and contemplation of the true, in pursuit of immortality. When the appointed term arrives and a worthy recipient appears, they shall report to the Nine Heavens before transmitting, never daring to leak them lightly or show them recklessly to others. They proclaim above to the myriad spirits and below to the Five Peaks, to the Three Rivers and Nine Springs, that all may bear witness.

To violate the covenant and betray its virtue is to condemn seven generations of ancestors, parents, and oneself to perpetual servitude under the Left Officials, treading the Knife Mountain, consuming fire, enduring the Twenty-Four Hells, the Three Paths and Five Sufferings, for ten thousand kalpas without remorse. They only beseech that the transmission be granted, and that true spirits, with jade lads and jade maidens, guard their form, that they may soon ascend and be delivered, soaring to the Upper Clarity. All prohibitions and precepts shall adhere to the covenant’s text.

When finished, the master holds the scripture in the left hand, and the disciple holds the tokens in the right. Facing heaven, they murmur: To the August High Mystery, the myriad emperors of the Void and Subtlety—those in the world below who hold fast to their vows, unwavering—dare they proclaim this covenant, to restrain all transgressions. The jade scriptures and precious instructions shall all conform to the statutes and rituals. After their deliverance, all qi shall return to the master’s lineage, eternally preserving heaven and earth, the Three Luminaries shining as one. Should any dare to leak them, they shall forever forfeit the Four Transgressions.

When finished, the disciple places the tokens before them, receives the scripture, faces north, and bows nine times before departing. This covenant may also universally deliver all scriptures, serving as the oath for all transmissions. Though other scriptures have their own covenants, the *Statutes of the Four Poles* governs all, encompassing the myriad traditions.

If no jade tablet is available, one of silver or wood may serve as a substitute. When the transmission is complete, the tablet is read aloud and buried beneath a sheer cliff, to stand as an eternal pledge and an oath witnessed by the myriad spirits. How can one not be cautious? How can one not be cautious?

The Azure Palace has its standards: for all who receive scriptures without pledging tokens and burying tablets to proclaim to the myriad spirits, their sincerity shall not reach the Most High, nor shall the myriad spirits distinguish their right. Thus, the tablet must not be omitted.

Here ends Scroll Five of the *Statutes of the Four Poles of the Most Real Jade Emperor*.

**The Supreme Perfection Jade Emperor’s Illuminated Precepts of the Four Poles**

**Sutra Title:** *The Supreme Perfection Jade Emperor’s Illuminated Precepts of the Four Poles* (abbreviated as *Illuminated Precepts of the Four Poles*).
Author unknown, approximately composed during the late Eastern Jin dynasty. A foundational disciplinary code of the early Shangqing tradition. Five scrolls.
Source text: *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, *Dongzhen* section, *Precepts and Disciplines* category.

---

### *The Supreme Perfection Jade Emperor’s Illuminated Precepts of the Four Poles*
**Scroll One**

At that time, the Most High Great Dao Lord bestowed upon the August Supreme Perfection Jade Emperor the *Illuminated Precepts of the Four Poles*, a code of one hundred and twenty statutes, to inspect the Heavenly Perfected Ones above, examine the Flying Immortals in the middle, and adjudicate the transgressions of the guilty below.

This jade scripture emerged from the annotations of the August Supreme Governor, enshrined within the Sevenfold Radiant Purple Chamber of the Lofty Jade Void. Its jade splendor formed the canon, golden immortals scattered incense, and five hundred million divine soldiers of the Five Thearchs, along with flying essence-clad cavalry, guarded the sacred text. Its reckoning spans the endless kalpas, presiding over the five transformations of fortune and the ninefold changes of sovereignty. When the time comes to assess the Perfected Ones who assist in the sagely governance, those with golden bones and jade viscera, bearing the Dark Chart and Purple Tablets, their names inscribed in the Upper Clarity, shall transmit the precepts in accordance with the code.

The Most High addressed the Golden Portal Emperor Lord, dispatching the Nine Numinous Jade Consorts to cast gold into tablets, bound with silver, while the Mother of Tortoises wielded the brush, the Supreme Perfection swept the mat, the Purple Dawn scattered incense, and the Great Florescence held the towel. Within the Purple Chamber of purity, they transcribed the jade scripture, then sealed it in a cloud-brocade pouch with cinnabar and azure seals.

Thereupon, the Most High Great Dao Lord led the Twenty-Four Emperors of the Lofty Jade Void and the Thirty-Nine Perfected Ones upward to the Radiant Purple Palace of the Utmost Utmost Utmost Non-Radiant Qi, where golden splendor and jade halls unfolded in ninefold chambers. They summoned the divine soldiers of the Five Thearchs, the ten million officials of the Four Poles, along with venomous dragons and colossal beasts, to guard the Ten Heavens.

At that moment, canopies of flowing rosy clouds and a thousand Perfected Ones of the Mulberry Grove, bearing nine-colored standards, flanked the numinous gates. Divine simurghs chanted in the dark, purple phoenixes wheeled in flight, jade flutes resounded with piercing tones, and the numinous chimes of the Jade Grove echoed. Golden blossoms scattered fragrance, jade consorts wafted incense, and the Four Assemblies of the Flying Empyrean converged with the Eightfold Penetrations of the Cavern Clarity. The Three Luminaries paused their radiance, night candles shone brightly, molten gold unleashed its might, and fiery bells blazed in descent. The Five Dawns aligned in brilliance, the Seven Primes subdued their essences, and a hundred million chariots with ten thousand cavalry filled the Purple Court in lush abundance.

The August Supreme Jade Emperor commanded the Jade Maidens of the Upper Palace—Xu Farong, Xiao Yizhong, Tian Sifei, Li Yunmen, and others—to strike the cloud-harp’s zither and join their voices in chanting the hymns of the Great Cavern’s lofty purity and the verses of the Three Paths’ dew-laden suffering.

The jade wisdom flutes rang clear, celestial melodies unfolded subtly, divine jade chimes trembled with resonance, and golden tones soared in emptiness. The transformative power reached the multitudes, unifying the myriad mechanisms at their inception.

**The Hymn:**

The Great Cavern encompasses the Three Wheels,
The primordial transformation holds form and formlessness.
Silent as a rootless teaching,
Solemn as a numinous might.

Alas, within the Three Paths,
Sorrow and suffering arise therefrom.
Through diligent study of these precepts,
Accumulate goodness to exhaust the kalpa’s span.

When the kalpa ends, transform and be reborn—
Body like a celestial brick, peer to sun and moon.
Foolishness follows worldly fancies,
Fleeting learning seeks vain glory.

Proclaiming transformation without discipline,
Lightly leaking the Heavenly Treasures’ scriptures,
Violating the code to enter death’s gate—
The Four Poles bind your name.

Soul and spirit tread the Nine Perils,
The Five Sufferings ever entangle you.
Feeding on fire, treading the Blade Mountains,
Hardship knows no moment’s respite.

Bewail this source of fortune and misfortune,
So clear amidst the vast and distant.
The Most High bequeaths stern precepts,
Fortune and misfortune move one to sigh.

The Dao of immortality is fated by destiny,
In darkness, it is already decreed.
Without destiny, it does not unfold;
Once awakened, one endures constant sorrow.

If one can revere the Dark Code,
Naturally one transcends the empyrean.
But if mired in the toils of love and desire,
Why persist in arrogance and frivolity?

Dwelling in transgression, the Four Luminaries bind,
Life and death tread the Eight Perils.
Dragged through the Five Sufferings’ courts,
The Three Paths’ knots remain unbroken.

The soul sinks into the Nine Darks’ plunder,
Ten thousand kalpas without dawn’s reprieve.
Grieve for this teaching of the Primordial Beginning—
How can it not evoke lament?

Vast and distant, above the Nine Mysteries,
Obscure, at the dawn of transformation’s inception.
Without form, without shadow,
Without depth, without measure.

The Two Modes initiate the unfolding of destiny,
Condensing qi to form sediment.
The Three Dawns illuminate the Dark Chamber,
The Five and Nine establish discipline.

Fortune and misfortune arise from humanity,
Good and evil—who indeed prevails?
If one can awaken to the Dark Enlightenment,
Transcendently rise above lofty doubts.

But if one wields the axe that hews fate,
Accumulating transgressions to fill the heart—
Sinking in guilt, the Four Luminaries bind,
The old punishments are truly deserved.

Born bearing the Blade Mountains,
The Five Sufferings know no end.
The Seven Mysteries fill the dark night,
Ten thousand kalpas mark a single epoch.

Lingering in the Three Paths,
Unawakened to life and death.

chunks.original_text: 於是高圣太真玉帝、高晨大师领仙玉郎，执升仙羽节、琼文帝章，宣告五灵，玉司扶位，万帝临轩，明皇启誓，奉授明科於太上大道君。 道君受玄戒，於时启付后圣九玄金阙帝君，使上治上清，中治十天，下掌万兆，总领群仙，普告万真，检定青宫有玄图紫简，名系玉皇，授於后学，咸使知戒，按科修行。 后圣帝君奉受太上大道君《四极明科》，封於金阙紫台玉映七宝之宫，经千七百年，传於上相青童君，青童君以传太极真人、南岳赤君、西城王君、玄洲仙伯、九灵王子等二十四真人。 王君封一通於王屋山西北玉室之中，经万劫当传后学得道之人。 若有玄图玉名，金骨紫藏，当得此文，得者神仙，白日升天。 侍文玉童玉女各三十六人，营卫有科者之身，记功明善。 探慎奉行，依盟宝秘，不得轻传。 泄露灵篇，九祖父母充元穷之役，负山运石，填积夜之河，吞火啖炭，万劫不原，身死幽泉，谢罪三官。 高上清微天玄三官，玉皇监司领仙君，所镇五帝神兵五万人。 第一左官，主执太真玉帝替慢之罪； 第二右官，主纠漏泄天宝之罪； 第三阴官，主元君亏犯科禁之罪。 禹余天三官，上真执司典非玉郎，所镇五帝神兵五万人。 第一左官，主阳过，刑杀伐逆，窃盗天宝，宣露灵文，口舌咒誓之罪； 第二右官，主阴过，心怀谋图不轨，谋害贤能，所念不道之罪； 第三都官，主疑贰天真，不崇不信，毁谤天宝，心怀进退，轻籍道经，秽慢真文之罪。 大赤天三官，总摄监灵使者，所镇五帝神兵五万人。 第一左官，主治生人之罪； 第二右官，主治死人之罪； 第三阴官，主治女人之罪。 又有水火左右二官。 左水官，治妄语诽谤，吱咽口舌，妬贤害能，不信天真，疑贰符章，訾毁宝文，妄说天地，宣泄秘篇，宣毁二象，触犯三辰者； 右火官治大逆杀生，伐害师君，反谋父母，手恶心贼，愿念不道之罪。 大丘山者，又有风刀左右二官。 左风考官，治受经符宝诀无盟修行，爱财贱道，亏损天科之罪； 第二右刀考官，治伏誓告盟，背违师友，去彼适此，评论善恶，攻伐根本，莫逆之罪。 玄中有三太空，即三官所治。 上三官，治太玄之上玉虚太空之中； 中三官，治上清太空； 下三官，治太极太空。 皆处玄虚之内，空洞之上，别置九府，在五岳玄虚洞室之中，善恶罪罚，莫不由於三官九府之司也。 刀山在岱宗之北，空洞小天之上，周回七千里，上置百二十曹府，千二百掾吏，执罚神兵五万人，主有罪犯於三官者，死魂皆使登山往反，万劫为一掠，穷魂楚痛，得经三掠，方诣流火之乡。 流火之乡在霍山之南，巨阳洞庭之内，周回五千里，罪魂悉付火乡，食火啖炭，憔魂苦痛，万劫为一掠，三掠得充三涂之役，担蒙山之土，填积夜之河，经三掠乃得还生不人之道。 三涂悉系太玄女青上宫酆都山，在北方癸地。 山上有八狱：第一监天狱、第二平天狱、第三虚无狱、第四自然狱、第五九平狱、第六清诏狱、第七玄天狱、第八元正狱，八狱主上天三官。 山中央又有八狱：第一玄沙北狱、第二皇天狱、第三禁罚狱、第四玄妙狱、第五刑正狱、第六律令狱、第七九天狱、第八清玲狱，八狱主中天三官。 山下又有八狱：第一无量狱、第二太真狱、第三玄都狱、第四三十六天大狱、第五天一北狱、第六河伯狱、第七累劫狱、第八女青狱，八狱主下三官。

Thus did the Most High Sagely Perfected Jade Emperor and the Supreme Dawn Great Master, leading the Immortal Jade Lords, wield the feathered staff of ascension and the jade-script imperial decrees, proclaiming to the Five Spirits. The Jade Bureau upheld its position, the myriad emperors attended at the throne, the Radiant August One inaugurated the oath, and the Luminous Statutes were reverently conferred upon the Most High Great Dao Lord.

The Dao Lord received the Mysterious Precepts and, at that time, transmitted them to the Later Sage Ninefold Mystery Golden Portal Emperor Lord, charging him to govern the Upper Clarity above, the Ten Heavens in the middle, and the myriad multitudes below, to oversee all immortals, and to universally proclaim to the myriad perfected. He was to examine and establish the Mysterious Charts and Purple Writs of the Azure Palace, whose names were inscribed in the Jade Emperor’s register, and to confer them upon later disciples, that all might know the precepts and cultivate their practice in accordance with the statutes.

The Later Sage Emperor Lord reverently received the *Four Poles Luminous Statutes* from the Most High Great Dao Lord and sealed them within the Golden Portal Purple Terrace Jade-Lustered Seven-Treasured Palace. After one thousand seven hundred years, they were transmitted to the Prime Minister Azure Lad, who in turn transmitted them to the Supreme Ultimate Perfected One, the Vermilion Lord of the Southern Marchmount, the Lord of the Western City, the Immortal Earl of the Mysterious Continent, the Ninefold Numinous Prince, and the twenty-four Perfected Ones.

The Lord of the Western City sealed one copy within the Jade Chamber of the northwest of Mount Wangwu, where it shall remain for ten thousand kalpas before being transmitted to those later disciples who attain the Dao. Should one possess the Mysterious Charts and jade-inscribed name, with golden bones and purple concealment, they shall obtain this text—those who do shall become immortals and ascend to heaven in broad daylight.

Thirty-six Jade Lads and thirty-six Jade Maidens attend the text, safeguarding the bodies of those who uphold the statutes, recording merits and illuminating virtue. One must diligently and cautiously observe these precepts, abiding by the sacred covenant and treasuring its secrecy. It must not be lightly transmitted. Should the numinous scriptures be divulged, the nine generations of one’s ancestors shall be consigned to the toil of the Primal Exhaustion, bearing mountains and transporting stones to fill the River of the Dark Night, swallowing fire and devouring coals. For ten thousand kalpas, they shall know no pardon; their bodies shall perish in the Dark Springs, and they shall make amends to the Three Officials.

The Three Officials of the Highest Clarity Subtle Heaven and the Mysterious Three Heavens, overseen by the Jade Emperor’s Surveillance Immortal Lords, command fifty thousand divine soldiers of the Five Emperors. The First Left Office governs the offenses of negligence toward the Most High Perfected Jade Emperor. The Second Right Office investigates the crimes of divulging celestial treasures. The Third Yin Office oversees the transgressions of the Primordial Lords in violating the statutory prohibitions.

The Three Officials of the Yu-Yu Heaven, administered by the Perfected Ones and the Jade Lords who oversee transgressions, command fifty thousand divine soldiers of the Five Emperors. The First Left Office governs yang offenses: the crimes of violence, killing, rebellion, theft of celestial treasures, divulging numinous texts, and perjurious curses. The Second Right Office governs yin offenses: the crimes of harboring treacherous plots, scheming against the worthy and able, and entertaining un-Dao-like thoughts. The Third Capital Office governs the offenses of doubting the celestial perfected, lacking reverence and faith, slandering celestial treasures, wavering in resolve, treating the Daoist scriptures lightly, and defiling the numinous texts.

The Three Officials of the Great Red Heaven, who oversee the surveillance of numinous emissaries, command fifty thousand divine soldiers of the Five Emperors. The First Left Office governs the crimes of the living. The Second Right Office governs the crimes of the dead. The Third Yin Office governs the crimes of women. Additionally, there are the Left and Right Offices of Water and Fire. The Left Water Office governs the offenses of false speech, slander, malicious gossip, envy of the worthy and harm to the able, disbelief in the celestial perfected, doubting talismans and registers, disparaging sacred texts, recklessly discoursing on heaven and earth, divulging secret scriptures, defaming the Two Modes, and offending the Three Luminaries. The Right Fire Office governs the crimes of great rebellion, killing living beings, harming one’s masters and lords, plotting against parents, malicious intent, and entertaining un-Dao-like thoughts.

The Great Mound Mountain also has the Left and Right Offices of Wind and Blade. The Left Wind Examination Office governs the offenses of receiving scriptures, talismans, treasured instructions, and covenants without proper vows, loving wealth and despising the Dao, and violating celestial statutes. The Second Right Blade Examination Office governs the crimes of breaking vows and covenants, betraying masters and friends, abandoning one for another, debating good and evil, and attacking the root of the Dao—offenses of profound disloyalty.

Within the Mysterious Center lie the Three Great Vacuities, which are the domains governed by the Three Officials. The Upper Three Officials govern the Jade Void of the Great Mystery above. The Middle Three Officials govern the Great Vacuity of the Upper Clarity. The Lower Three Officials govern the Great Vacuity of the Supreme Ultimate. All reside within the Mysterious Vacuity, above the Hollow Caverns, where nine bureaus are separately established within the Mysterious Vacuity Grotto Chambers of the Five Marchmounts. There is no crime or punishment that does not fall under the jurisdiction of the Three Officials and Nine Bureaus.

The Knife Mountains lie north of Mount Tai, above the Hollow Caverns of the Lesser Heaven, encircling seven thousand *li*. Above them are one hundred twenty offices and one thousand two hundred subordinate officials, commanding fifty thousand divine soldiers who mete out punishments. Those who have committed crimes against the Three Officials, their souls after death, are made to ascend and descend the mountains. For ten thousand kalpas, they endure one lashing; after three lashings, their suffering souls may proceed to the Land of Flowing Fire.

The Land of Flowing Fire lies south of Mount Huo, within the Vast Yang Cavern Court, encircling five thousand *li*. The sinful souls are all consigned to this fiery realm, where they feed on fire and devour coals, their emaciated souls enduring agony. For ten thousand kalpas, they endure one lashing; after three lashings, they are assigned to the toil of the Three Paths, bearing the soil of Mount Meng to fill the River of the Dark Night. Only after three lashings may they return to the path of rebirth among the unenlightened.

The Three Paths are all connected to the Azure Upper Palace of the Great Mystery Woman in Mount Fengdu, located in the northern *gui* region. Upon this mountain are eight prisons: the First Celestial Surveillance Prison, the Second Celestial Equilibrium Prison, the Third Void Prison, the Fourth Natural Prison, the Fifth Ninefold Equilibrium Prison, the Sixth Clarion Decree Prison, the Seventh Mysterious Heaven Prison, and the Eighth Primordial Rectitude Prison—these eight prisons are overseen by the Upper Heaven Three Officials.

At the mountain’s center are another eight prisons: the First Mysterious Sands Northern Prison, the Second August Heaven Prison, the Third Prohibitive Punishment Prison, the Fourth Mysterious Wonder Prison, the Fifth Punitive Rectitude Prison, the Sixth Statutory Decree Prison, the Seventh Nine Heavens Prison, and the Eighth Clarion Jade Prison—these eight prisons are overseen by the Middle Heaven Three Officials.

Beneath the mountain are yet another eight prisons: the First Boundless Prison, the Second Great Perfected Prison, the Third Mysterious Capital Prison, the Fourth Thirty-Six Heavens Great Prison, the Fifth Heaven One Northern Prison, the Sixth River Earl Prison, the Seventh Kalpic Accumulation Prison, and the Eighth Azure Woman Prison—these eight prisons are overseen by the Lower Three Officials.

chunks.original_text: 凡二十四狱，并置邓都山之北，狱有十二掾吏，金头铁面巨天力士各二千四百人，手把金槌铁杖。 凡犯玄科死魂，各付所属狱，身为力士铁杖所考，万劫为一掠，三掠乃得还补三涂之责。 太上告金阙帝君曰：凡人生天地之内，六合之中，而不知生死宿命，罪福之根，良可痛哉。 善恶因缘，莫不有报。 生世施功布德，救度一切，身后化生福堂，超过八难，受人之庆，天报自然。 生世好学，志念神仙，崇奉玄科，敬信灵文，念善改恶，立行入真，身后化生，得接帝皇，名书紫简，上升玉晨，生世乐道，不惮苦寒，随师执役，惟劳为先，饥渴务效，不生怨言，身后化生，得策飞軿，游宴五岳，乘虚落烟。 生世翘贞，不淫不奸，不贪不欲，见色无欢，心如死灰，执固道源，身后化生，得报灵人，超度三涂，五苦不经。 生世施善，愿天普降，同得升度，去离八难，众身不过，己身不安，割己之服，以拯穷寒，损粮饷乌，遗物空山，四司称善，感彻玉皇，书名紫简，札补上仙。 生世忠孝，恭奉尊亲，崇敬胜己，宗礼师君，腹目相和，如同一身，心无拓能，口无轻言，内外齐并，动止合真，身后化生，得受灵人，不经三涂，超过八难，善善相系，福福相因，如此之报，道岂负人。 生世不良，怀恶抱奸，攻伐师本，反毁圣文，不崇灵章，疑贰天真，外心浮好，假求华荣，口是心非，行负道源，窃盗经书，不盟而宣，泄露秘诀，流放非真，违科犯忌，身入罪门，七祖横罹，责及穷魂，身死负掠，食火践山，三涂五苦，万劫不原，楚挞幽夜，痛切其身。 夫欲修学，熟寻此文，祸福之报，岂可具言。 夫有金名於帝图，玉字於紫简，得受《四极明科》百二十条检者，皆宿挺应仙。 但当依科修奉，崇善顺法，以期神明精感，玄虚玉帝赏别，四界司迎出入，远近莫不稽首，奉侍於兆身也。 兆当绝行阴阳，勿与俗人共相交关，履生死之秽，触忤真灵，啖食五熏，气充胃府，损精丧神，裸露三光，轻慢玉晨，自收其咎，祸灭兆身，故以相告，详而奉行。 有得明科之身，不得妄与常学谈说经文，评论玄古，意通至真，宣传非所，泄露道源，妄示世人，殃及七祖死魂充责，长补河源，形役九幽，痛不可言。 奉受上法，崇修明科，皆当以八节之日，及本命之日，清斋烧香，悔过帝君，拔罪九阴，解散七玄。 常至立春、春分之日，燃九灯於中庭，立夏、夏至燃三灯，立秋、秋分燃七灯，立冬、冬至燃五灯，本命之日燃十二灯。 夜半露出灯下，立春、春分则东向，立夏、夏至则南向，立秋、秋分则西向，立冬、冬至则北向，本命则太岁之上，叩齿二十四通，微咒曰：. 高上太真，万圣帝皇，五帝玉司，总仙监真，今日吉辰八节，开陈阳罪阴考，绝灭九阴，永始拔释七玄，免脱火乡，永离刀山，三涂五苦，不累我身，得同天地，长保帝晨，五愿八会，靡不如言。 毕，解巾，叩头百二十过，当额向地而已，勿令痛也。 竟，复巾，仰天心念：我身今日上享天恩，赐及形骸，受生飞仙。 毕，仰咽二十四气止。 如此三年，宿愆并除，身与真同，不履五苦，脱过火乡，克得真人游宴兆房，可谓妙诀，慎勿轻传。 四极有四方五帝玉司君典之，普统四极，无高无下，无深无浅，周匝无穷之劫，莫不总检善恶，祸福皆系玉司之君也。
chunks.translated_text:
The twenty-four prisons are all situated north of Mount Dengdu. Each prison is staffed with twelve subordinate officers and twenty-four hundred mighty celestial enforcers—golden-headed, iron-faced, and wielding golden hammers and iron staves. All souls who violate the Mysterious Statutes and meet death are consigned to their respective prisons, where the enforcers’ iron staves administer punishment. A single lash endures for ten thousand kalpas; only after three lashes may the soul be released to atone for its transgressions in the Three Wretched Realms.

The Most High addressed the Golden Portal Lord of the Imperial Palace, saying: “All people born within the Six Directions of Heaven and Earth yet remain ignorant of their predestined lives and deaths, the roots of sin and fortune—how grievous this is! The causes of good and evil invariably yield their recompense. Those who in life perform meritorious deeds and spread virtue, rescuing and delivering all beings, shall after death transform and be born in halls of fortune, transcending the Eight Difficulties, receiving human felicitations, and earning the natural rewards of Heaven.

Those who in life devote themselves to study, aspire to the Dao of immortals, revere the Mysterious Statutes, honor and believe in the sacred scriptures, turn from evil to embrace goodness, and establish conduct to enter the Real, shall after death transform and be received by the Thearchs. Their names shall be inscribed on purple tablets and ascend to the Jade Dawn, where they shall dwell in the Dao’s joy, undeterred by hardship or cold. Following their masters, they prioritize labor, endure hunger and thirst without complaint, and after death transform to ride flying chariots, roaming and feasting upon the Five Peaks, traversing the void and descending through mist.

Those who in life maintain steadfast integrity, neither licentious nor deceitful, neither greedy nor desirous, unmoved by sensual allure, their hearts as cold as dead ashes, and hold fast to the source of the Dao, shall after death transform and be rewarded as numinous beings, transcending the Three Wretched Realms and sparing themselves the Five Sufferings.

Those who in life perform good deeds, wishing Heaven’s universal deliverance so that all may ascend and escape the Eight Difficulties—even if others remain unenlightened, they themselves find no peace, sacrificing their own garments to relieve the destitute and cold, sharing their provisions with birds, and leaving offerings in desolate mountains—shall be praised by the Four Controllers. Their virtue shall move the Jade Thearch, their names inscribed on purple tablets, and they shall be appointed as ascending immortals.

Those who in life are loyal and filial, reverently serving their elders and superiors, honoring those wiser than themselves, and venerating their masters and lords as if their eyes and bellies were one with their own, their hearts free of arrogance, their speech devoid of frivolity, their inner and outer selves aligned, and their actions in accord with the Real, shall after death transform and become numinous beings. They shall not traverse the Three Wretched Realms nor endure the Eight Difficulties. Goodness begets goodness, fortune begets fortune—such is the Dao’s recompense, which never fails humanity.

Those who in life are wicked, harboring malice and deceit, attacking their masters’ foundations, slandering sacred scriptures, failing to revere the numinous texts, doubting the celestial immortals, feigning virtue for vain glory, speaking falsely while their hearts remain treacherous, betraying the source of the Dao, stealing scriptures without oath, recklessly disseminating them, divulging secret formulas, spreading false teachings, violating statutes and taboos—such souls enter the gates of sin. Their seven generations of ancestors suffer calamity, their destitute spirits are held accountable, their bodies endure flogging after death, consume fire, tread mountains, and endure the Three Wretched Realms and Five Sufferings for ten thousand kalpas without reprieve. Beaten in the dark of night, their pain is unbearable.

Those who wish to cultivate and study must carefully ponder this text. How can the retributions of fortune and misfortune be fully described? Those whose golden names are recorded in the Thearch’s register and whose jade characters are inscribed on purple tablets, who receive and uphold the *One Hundred Twenty Articles of the Luminous Statutes of the Four Poles*, are all destined to become immortals. They must abide by the statutes, cultivate goodness, and follow the Dao, thereby attaining the resonance of divine clarity. The Jade Thearch of the Mysterious Void shall discern their merit, and the Four Controllers shall welcome them in their comings and goings. Near and far, none shall fail to bow in reverence and serve their destined forms.

Disciples must sever all dealings with the mundane, avoiding association with ordinary people, lest they tread the filth of life and death, offend the true numina, consume the five pungent foods, fill their stomachs with turbid qi, deplete their essence and spirit, expose themselves to the Three Luminaries, and slight the Jade Dawn. Such transgressions invite self-inflicted calamity, bringing ruin upon their destined forms. This warning is given in earnest; heed it with care.

Those who receive the *Luminous Statutes* must not recklessly discuss scriptures with ordinary students, debate ancient mysteries, or presume to comprehend the utmost Real. To recklessly transmit or divulge the source of the Dao, or show it to worldly people, shall bring calamity upon their seven generations of ancestors and their dead souls, consigning them to eternal atonement at the River Source, their forms enslaved in the Nine Dark Realms, their suffering beyond words.

Those who receive and uphold the supreme methods and cultivate the *Luminous Statutes* must, on the eight solar terms and their own life-destiny days, purify themselves with fasting, burn incense, and repent before the Imperial Lord to absolve their sins in the Nine Yin and dissolve the Seven Mysteries. On the days of *Lichun* and the Spring Equinox, light nine lamps in the central courtyard; on *Lixia* and the Summer Solstice, light three lamps; on *Liqiu* and the Autumn Equinox, light seven lamps; on *Lidong* and the Winter Solstice, light five lamps; and on their life-destiny day, light twelve lamps. At midnight, place the lamps outdoors, facing east on *Lichun* and the Spring Equinox, south on *Lixia* and the Summer Solstice, west on *Liqiu* and the Autumn Equinox, north on *Lidong* and the Winter Solstice, and toward the Year Star on their life-destiny day. Knock their teeth twenty-four times and softly recite the incantation:

*Supreme and Most True, Ten Thousand Sage Thearchs,
Five Thearchs and Jade Controllers, Overseers of All Immortals,
On this auspicious day of the eight solar terms,
We declare the dissolution of yang sins and yin punishments,
Sever the Nine Yin, forever absolve the Seven Mysteries,
Escape the fiery realms, forever leave the Mountain of Knives,
The Three Wretched Realms and Five Sufferings shall not burden my form.
May I be as enduring as Heaven and Earth, forever safeguarded by the Imperial Dawn.
May the Five Vows and Eight Assemblies be fulfilled as spoken.*

Upon completion, remove their headscarf, bow their head one hundred twenty times, touching their forehead to the ground without causing pain. Then, replace the headscarf, gaze upward, and silently recite: *“Today, my form receives the grace of Heaven’s favor, bestowed upon my mortal frame, to be reborn as a flying immortal.”* Conclude by swallowing twenty-four breaths of qi. After three years of such practice, all past transgressions shall be eradicated, their form shall become one with the Real, they shall not tread the Five Sufferings, escape the fiery realms, and attain the status of a true person, freely roaming their destined abode. This is a wondrous formula; guard it well and do not transmit it lightly.

The Four Poles are governed by the Four Directional and Five Thearch Jade Controller Lords, who universally oversee all realms—without height or depth, shallowness or profundity, and through boundless kalpas. None escape their comprehensive judgment of good and evil, for all fortunes and misfortunes are bound to the Jade Controller Lords.

chunks.original_text: 四方八域无鞅数官，皆玉司游司之号耶。 太玄上宫女青四极明科律文 青帝玉司君，姓梁，讳叔度，衣飞青羽衣，九色凤章，头戴九元宝冠，手执九色之节，治东太明阳台洞天皇玄都女青上宫，领东岳泰山官，地灵水精，青甲之兵。 束极无金之天、无鞅数劫、无极无穷之官，悉隶於青帝玉司之君。 主人生死之命，知其名，存其神，九年修行，致有青云飞盖，来迎兆身。 太玄都四极明科曰：高上玉清太真帝皇，有犯明科之目，退编皇之箓，降游散真皇，治太清中宫七百年，随格进号。 太玄都四极明科曰：上清真人不勤王事，在局替慢，亏废真任，漏泄宝诀，降授非真，皆退上真之箓，充五岳都校之主千年，随勤进号。 太玄都四极明科曰：受上元夫人之位，元君之号，不勤帝局，亏替王事，降适过礼，朝宴失节，轻泄天宝，降授不真，皆削真皇之录，退紫虚之位，置於中玄清微游散灵官七百年，随勤进号。 太玄都四极明科曰：受太清仙人之号，不勤典局，稽替王事，亏废真任，或泄露天科，传降非所，削真仙之箓，退充五岳都役主者二千四百年，随勤进号。 太玄都四极明科曰：受五岳飞仙之号，不任王事，亏替仙局，轻慢道文，退正仙之箓，充补三官都校之主二千四百年，随勤进号。 太玄都四极明科曰：诸受五帝四司三官都校之位，不任正局，稽殆亏略，替忽天典，废阙王事，纠罚不当，怨灵称枉，滥天不理，皆克削正真之爵，退补都统书吏三千六百年，有勤进号。 太玄都四极明科曰：诸受上真玉札，所掌门监玉郎、羽仙侍郎、上宫典格都统、玉真领仙侍郎、主禁大夫、典仙羽童、都官司正，各不任其局，稽废王事，亏略天科，皆削上真之札，责补三官书吏，统领鬼爽七千年，有勤者随善进号。 太玄都四极明科曰：黄书赤界，真一之道，此交接之小术，亦道手之秘事，其理妙崄，皆二象离合，三气相和，浊灾#1，解厄，还精养神，令人不死。 受此法者，有亏损正气，心生爱欲，混浊不节，嫉妬疑贰，攻伐师本，更相谗讪，其禁尤重。 有犯此罪，己身及七祖，同充左右二宫之罚，履山食火，负石填河，三涂五苦经三掠得过，然后长充鬼役。

The innumerable officials across the Four Directions and Eight Domains—are they not all designations of the Jade Controller and Wandering Controller Lords?

*Tai Xuan Upper Palace’s Nü Qing Four Poles Bright Statutes and Ordinances*

The Eastern Pole’s Boundless Metal-less Heaven, the innumerable kalpas, and the infinite, inexhaustible offices all fall under the jurisdiction of the Azure Thearch Jade Controller Lord. He presides over the life and death of beings; those who know his name and invoke his spirit through nine years of cultivation shall attain azure clouds and a flying canopy to welcome their destined form.

The *Tai Xuan Capital Four Poles Bright Statutes* state: Should the Supreme Jade Clarity Grand Perfected Thearch Emperor violate the statutes’ provisions, his name shall be stricken from the Imperial Register, and he shall be demoted to a Wandering Dispersed Perfected Thearch, governing the Great Clarity’s Central Palace for seven hundred years, with promotion contingent upon merit.

The *Tai Xuan Capital Four Poles Bright Statutes* state: Should one who has received the title of Great Clarity Immortal neglect their office, delay imperial affairs, shirk their true duties, or leak celestial statutes, transmitting them to the unworthy, their name shall be stricken from the Register of Perfected Immortals, and they shall be demoted to serve as the Chief of the Five Marchmounts’ Laborers for two thousand four hundred years, with promotion contingent upon diligence.

The *Tai Xuan Capital Four Poles Bright Statutes* state: Should one who has received the title of Flying Immortal of the Five Marchmounts fail in their imperial duties, shirk their immortal office, or show contempt for the Dao’s texts, their name shall be stricken from the Register of Orthodox Immortals, and they shall be demoted to serve as the Chief of the Three Offices’ Hosts for two thousand four hundred years, with promotion contingent upon diligence.

The *Tai Xuan Capital Four Poles Bright Statutes* state: Should any who hold the positions of the Five Thearchs’ Four Controllers, Three Offices’ Chiefs, or Hosts of the Offices neglect their proper duties, delay or neglect their tasks, disregard celestial statutes, abandon imperial affairs, impose unjust punishments, provoke grievances from spirits, or act with reckless impropriety, their orthodox and true ranks shall be revoked, and they shall be demoted to serve as Clerks of the Hosts’ Command for three thousand six hundred years, with promotion contingent upon diligence.

chunks.original_text: 上宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：上清天皇、地皇、人皇大字，皆大有清虚妙法，洞元宝文，自无金名方诸青宫，不得知闻。 有其文者，立成地仙，亦登玄虚，位及仙卿。 而轻慢天真，泄灵宝文，传非其人，冒殗履秽，不恭有露，违犯其禁，七祖受考，责充右官，经刀山食火，负石填河，各经一掠，得化生非人之体。 己身充左官之罚，履山啖火，三涂五苦之难，悉过三掠，得充补鬼役。 北帝女青上宫律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：洞玄灵宝上经，大劫、小劫、五符、玉诀，上清宝文，玄洞之道，自无玉骨玄图，紫字录名，不得见闻。 有其文，则玉童玉女侍卫。 当烧香礼拜，如奉君父，清斋诵经，立登云舆，宴景五岳，位掌灵山。 而不崇奉，秽慢真文，轻露宣泄，流放非真，有犯其禁，七祖充责，考属右官，罚以少山#2火乡之难，三涂五苦各二掠得过，生非人之道。 己身充左官之考，罚以刀山食火，负石填河，三涂五苦之难三掠得过，还长充幽夜无极鬼役。 北帝女青上宫律文。 受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：高上《大洞真经三十九章》、《素灵大有妙经》、《雌一玉检五老宝经》、《金华洞房紫书上文》、《龟山元箓》、《青箓白简金根上经》、《太霄琅书琼文帝章》，上宫宝篇，凡三十一卷，此独立之诀，乃高玉玄映之道。 洞天玉清宝文，授於已成真人，有金骨玉藏，名书帝简，录札紫庭，得见此文。 得者玉童玉女侍卫，当烧香左右，晨夕礼拜，如奉君父，长斋玄岫，诵咏灵章，立致云舆，飞升玉清，位登金阙，与帝同轩。 受而不恭，亏科息慢，不信天真，轻泄宝诀，宣露圣文，使世见闻，为玉童所奏，七祖父母考属右官，罚以刀山火乡，三涂五苦之难二掠得过，还化生非人之道。 己身考属左官，罚以刀山食火，负石填河，二十四狱三涂五苦之难，三掠得过，乃得长充幽夜无极鬼役。 如北帝女青上宫律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：上清大有六天宫俯仰之格，上道宝经三百卷，玉诀九千言，符章七千篇，此玉清宝文，藏於太上灵都之宫，七映紫房之内，传於已成真人，有玄名帝图，紫字玉清，得见此文者，玉童玉女侍卫其身。 烧香礼拜，如奉君父，不淫不秽，不轻不慢，立致云舆，白日升天。 而轻泄此文，秽慢天宝，评说灵章，宣露妄示非人，七祖考属右官，二十四狱罚以三涂之难，二掠得过，还生非人之道。 己身考属左官，罚以刀山食火之难，掠三过乃还，负石填河，长充幽夜三涂五苦之役。 北帝女青上宫律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：《上清金液丹经》、《九鼎神图》、《琅玕华丹飞霜起雪四琼绛生紫浆藏景灵丸》、《太一九转立成大丹》、《上化胎精中记》，凡一百四十卷，此乃中真腾化之道。 授於应为真人者，有金名方诸宫，当得此经。 得者丹成，变化七十四方，乘虚驾云，飞升上清，五色紫黄金银立成，当秘而修行。 不得轻慢秽怠天真，宣露灵文以示俗人，犯者考属左官，罚以风刀之罪，见世之难，死充负石之役，一掠得过，反生更胎四夷之中。 〔上宫〕女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：《五岳真形神图》，乃与天地俱生，置三十二天洞庭之宫，置於上真飞仙仙人之所，居其上神草玉芝，令人不死。

chunks.original_text: 信而不宝，真其罪也。 三者既同，考延七玄、己身，被左右二官所考，罚以刀山，三涂五苦，九厄八难，万劫得生不人之道。 玄都下宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太真玉帝四极明科经卷之二竟 太真玉帝四极明科经卷之三 太玄都左宫女青四极明科律文 赤帝玉司君，姓玉，讳景度，衣绛章单衣，九色凤章，头戴平天飞神玉冠，手执九色之节，治南朱阳之台洞天，太玄都女青左右，领南岳霍山仙官，地灵水精，赤丙之兵。 南极无崖之天，无鞅数劫，无穷无极之官，总统上真之格，悉隶於赤帝玉司之君。 主人生死之命，知其名，存其神，修行九年，致神草玉芝不死之药，丹霞紫云下迎兆身，上升玉清宫。 太玄都四极明科曰：《大洞真经三十九章》，高上九皇道君元始自然玉章，一名太真道经，一名三天龙书，秘於高上大有之天，九玄玉房之内，侍经玉童玉女各三千人，烧香卫灵，传於中央黄老君。 旧科万劫一传，若有玄名帝图，紫简绿字，玉藏金骨之人，千年内听得三传。 盟上金十两，铜二十五斤，金钮五双，金鱼、玉龙各一枚，青丝一两，师弟子对斋百日，或九十日、三十日，北向，缠金钮，告盟而传。 金晨玉童二十四人、西华玉女三十六人，侍经烧香。 得此文者，诵咏万遍，立升上清，拔度七祖，更胎南仙。 违盟负戒，一犯伐功断事，万不得仙，三犯上及七祖、己身，同被左右二官所考，罚以刀山，诣火啖炭，二十四狱，三涂五苦之难，三掠乃得过，长充下鬼负石填河之役，玉童玉女赍经，还於上宫也。 玄都左右女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太上玄都四极明科曰：《雌一玉检五老宝经》，灵书紫文，乃高玄映之道，高上帝君所修，上愿十二玄母八间九转，五迥变化雌雄。 传於众帝、上元禁君、三元夫人、紫微王母、后圣九玄金阙帝君，秘在九天之上大有之宫，太玄灵台玉房之中，紫金为素，以撰其文，青绿为字，以书其章，侍经玉童玉女各三千人，烧香典经。 旧科万劫一传，若有玄名帝图，紫简绿字，金骨玉藏之人，七千年内听得三传。 盟上金五两，五色锦缯各五十尺，香一斤，金钮三双，师弟子对斋九十日，北向告盟而传。 玉童二十九人、玉女二十七人，常宝典灵文。 得此文者，修行万徧，飞升上清，其禁尤重，不得妄传。 愆盟违信，一犯伐功断事，万不得仙，三犯者上及七祖、己身，同被左右二官所考，罚以刀山诣火，下鬼负石填河之役，玉童责经，还反上宫也。 玄都左宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：《太上素灵洞玄大有妙经》，秘於九天之上大有之宫，金台玉室素灵房中，刻玉为简，以撰为文，金镂玉字，以明其篇。 传於天帝君、南极上元君、太微天帝君、后圣九玄金阙帝君，今封三宝奇经各一通，於岱宗山中。 旧科万劫一出，有金名玉字，紫剖玄图之人，七千年内听得三传。 盟上金三两，紫纹百尺，青缯二十七尺，赤丝五两，香一斤，丹一两，师弟子对斋百日，告北帝，盟天而传。 给玉童玉女各二十四人，烧香侍经。 修行百日，与真通灵，九年道降，白日登天。 不得愆盟犯律，一犯伐功断事，三犯上延七祖、己身，并被左右二官所考，罚以刀山食火，二十四狱，三涂五苦之中，三掠得过，乃得长充负石填河之役。

chunks.original_text: 玉童玉女责经，反於上宫也。 玄都左右女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：《九真中经》，太上太微天帝君所修，八道九真结璘郁仪，上奔日月之道，以传中央黄老君，秘於太上六合宫中。 旧科七千年听得二传，若有青书束华，玉字上清，藏生紫络之人，七百年内听得三传。 盟白绢九十尺，青丝一斤，绛缯二十四尺，此日晖之誓，碧缯二十四尺，此月华之誓，金环三双，元常童子之信，对斋九十日、二十四日，北向告盟而传。 给玉童玉女各十七人。 修此道七年，乘云飞行，上升太清。 其法尤重，二犯伐功断事，四犯左右二官所考，七祖、己身，罚以刀山食火地狱，三涂五苦之役万劫，还生不人之道。 玄都左宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科日：《太丹隐书洞真玄经》，一名帝君七化变景九形，一名太一三度帝宝五精，一名帝一混合三五立成。 太一帝君所受，空玄自然之章，藏於太上六合紫房之内，传於南极元君、太素三元君、紫微王母，今封一通於岱宗山中。 旧科万劫一出，有金名帝图，绿字紫简，骨气含真之人，七百年内听得三传。 盟青缯二十七尺，素丝五两，和香二裹，笔一枚，纸百番，丹一两，帝君不宣泄之盟，师弟子对斋百日，告盟而传。 给玉女九人、玉童七人，侍卫烧香。 修五神混合之道，百日真灵下降，不出七年，白日升天。 不得违科犯盟，一犯伐功断事，三犯七祖、己身，并充左右二官考，罚以刀山食火，二十四狱，三涂五苦之中，三掠得过，长充负石填河之役。 玄都左宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科日：《紫度炎光玄真变经》、《中方内视》、《上清变化七十四方》，三卷受於九天真王，太宫九玄之高章，秘於太上灵都之宫紫房之内，三元君主之。 万劫一传，若有金名帝简，绿字上清，合真之人，七百年内有其人，听得三传。 紫度盟，用五色锦各五十尺，上金五两，沉香五斤，真珠一斤，书刀一口，金镮七枚，绛文七十尺； 上清变化盟，青缯四十尺，上金十两，金钮六双，好香一斤，金鱼、玉龙各一枚，师弟子对斋九十日，或三十日、九日，告盟而授。 给玉童二十四人、玉女三十六人，烧香侍真。 修之百日，变化虚无，九年白日升天。 违科犯律，一犯伐功断事，三犯七祖、父母、己身，并属左右二官考，罚以刀山食火，二十四狱，三涂五苦之中，三掠得过，长充负石填河之役。 玄都左宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：《神洲七转七变舞天》，一名藏景匿形，一名出有入无，乃上皇先生紫晨君所受，太空自然之章，秘於紫天元台玉室金房之内，万劫一出，传玄成清天上皇君、三天玉童、紫极真元君、南极上元君、太微天帝君、后圣道君，今封一通於西城山中。 若有紫名上清，金字束华之人，七百年内听得三传。 师弟子对斋九十日，告盟而授。

chunks.original_text: 盟青缯九疋，腓缯三疋，皂绢五疋，白缯七疋，黄缯十二疋，金鱼、玉龙各一枚，以誓九天不泄之约。 给玉童玉女各二人。 愆盟违科，三犯伐功断事，不得又仙，五犯七祖、父母、己身，并充左右二官，罚以刀山食火地狱，三涂五苦之中万劫，得生不人之道。 玄都左宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：《金真玉光太上隐书》，太上大道君所受，九玄之精，秘於灵都之宫七映之户，侍卫玉女三千人。 旧科万劫一出，若有金名於帝图，录字於上清者，七百年内听得三传。 盟上金五两，丹纹之缯八十尺，真珠一斤，以誓九天。 师弟子对斋百日，告盟而传。 给玉童玉女各七十七人。 违科负律，五犯七祖、己身，并充左右二官之考，罚以刀山火乡，二十四狱，三涂五苦之中，万劫得还，长充负石填河之役。 玄都左宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：《丹景道精隐地八卫》，太上玉晨受之於高圣，秘於上清金台玉室，玉童玉女各八百人，侍卫烧香。 传於太极真人、东华大神。 方诸青宫旧科，七千年一出，若有金名玉字於玄图，合真之人，七百年内听得传八人。 盟誓白绢四十尺，紫纹八十尺，金钮八双，以代列誓之信。 师弟子对斋八十日，北向而传。 给玉童玉女各十二人。 违科犯盟，一犯不得又仙，三犯七祖、父母、己身，并充左右二官之考，罚以刀山火乡，二十四狱，三涂五苦之中，万劫乃得还，长充下鬼之役。 玄都左宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：《外国放品青童内文》，乃上清太真玉保王，上相大司马高晨师，束海玉门青华小童君所受，秘在方诸青宫，侍经玉童三百人。 旧科七千年三出，告盟而传。 给玉童玉女各二十七人。 得此文者，太一改命，青宫定仙。 不得愆盟负科，一犯伐功断事，不得又仙，三犯七祖、父母、己身，并充左右二官，罚以刀山火乡，二十四狱，三涂五苦之中，三掠得过，乃得充负石填河之役。 玄都左宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：《三元玉检三元布经》，三天之上大有之宫，三天玉童所受，九玄自生之章，秘於九清之上大道之宫，侍经玉女玉童二千四百人。 旧科万劫一出，传付上元禁君、南极上元君、西王母、金阙帝君，今封一通於霍山之室。 若有金名玉字於东华，七百年内听得三传。 盟用上金五两，凤纹之罗九十尺，青纹三十二尺，师弟子对斋七十日，告盟而传。 给玉女二十七人，玉童三十二人，侍卫典文。 得者仙籍注名，三元诣房。 违科负信，一犯伐功断事，不得又仙，三犯七祖、父母、己身，并充左右二官之考，刀山食火之难，二十四狱万劫乃过，长充负石填河之役。 玄都左宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：《上化九丹胎精中记》、乃生九玄之初，二十四真，九帝所行，太帝传於南极夫人，西王母，今封一通於瀛洲方丈。 七千年一出，若有金名合真，三百年内听二传。 盟用上金一斤九两，白绢八十尺，丹一斤，以代列誓之信。 师弟子对斋九十日，北向而传。 给玉童玉女各九人。 得者变化随意，飞行太空。 违负明科，三犯不得又仙，五犯己身遭风刀之考，死入地狱万劫，还生不人之道。

chunks.original_text: 黑帝玉司君，姓史，讳升度，衣皂文之衣，五色凤章，头戴玉精通天宝冠，手执五色羽节，治玄阴太冥洞天右宫，领北岳恒山仙官，地灵水精，黑壬之兵。 北统无崖之天，无鞅劫数，无穷无极之官，总领上真之格，悉隶於黑帝玉司之君。 主人生死之命，知其名，存其神，修行九年，致皂云飞舆来迎兆身，上升玄宫。 太玄都四极明科曰：凡高上太真、玉皇帝君、玉清真人、万仙众圣、得道灵人，皆佩《太真明科》，检制众真科文，秘於九天无鞅之宫，七宝华房，侍文太华玉女七千人，金神玉童九千人，烧香典灵。 旧科经无鞅之劫，传二十四人。 轻科慢禁，违犯玉律，皆削真皇之箓，充游散之官，如上之文，随功进号。 玄都右宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：凡学之士，受《九真明科》，三品二十七条，三素之上篇，秘於太上灵都之宫，素灵玉女三千人、金神玉童四千人，侍卫典香。 旧科九万劫传九人。 誓盟紫金十两，紫纹百尺，以誓九天。 有金骨玉名，合真之人，依盟而传。 师弟子对斋九十日，北向告。 给玉童玉女二十四人。 轻科慢禁，漏泄宝诀，己身、七祖，并充刀山火乡，二十四狱，三涂五苦之难，万劫方还，下鬼负石之役。 玄都右宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：《四极明科》，乃高圣之玉诀，太上大道君之所受，秘於金简紫台玉映七宝之宫，侍之玉女、玉童，各二千四百人。 科终无数之劫，遇有金名玄图，绿字上清，宝藏玉骨之人，盟而传之。 盟五色锦缯各九十尺，凤纹之罗四十尺，金鱼、玉龙各一枚，长一尺二寸，以纪受科年月，以封於本命之岳，以誓九天之信。 对斋百日，告盟而传。 给玉童玉女各三十六人。 轻科慢律，漏泄宝文，己身七祖，并充刀山食火之难，二十四狱，三涂五苦之中万劫，得充下鬼负石之役。 玄都右宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：《灵宝洞玄经五胜玉诀》，皆太上之宝文，玉帝之玄章，本出九天父母，封於太上玉京金房紫户之内，万劫一出，今封各一通於太山之北，一通於劳盛山。 若有金骨玉藏，言名帝录，千年得传三人。 盟信，上皇之初，皆金钱为誓，今以紫纹五十尺，金二两，金镮二双，以准列誓之盟。 师弟子对斋百日，分帛而传。 侍经玉女九人，玉童十二人。 得者修行，位加仙卿。 轻文慢宝，泄露至真，七祖、父母、己身，同被左右二官所考，登刀山火乡，二十四狱，三涂五苦万劫得还，充下鬼负石之役。 玄都右宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：天皇、地皇、人皇，《三皇内文大字》，或曰洞神，一名洞仙，一名太上玉策。 皇上元人所修，太上道君所秘大有之宫，七千年而出。 今五岳悉封一通。 若有金名玉字於方诸宫，四十年听传。 法盟白绢四十尺，金三两，古用白鸡歃血为盟，今以金素代准。 世无其师，当投物山栖，按而奉焉。 师授斋三日，告盟。 给玉女、玉童各九人。 违科慢禁，五犯废功断事，七犯死没三官，罚以地狱三涂五苦之役万劫，还生不人之道。 玄都右宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：《五岳真形图》，上皇之所秘，太上大道君所修，西王母之所行。

The Black Emperor Lord of the Jade Bureau, surnamed Shi, personal name Shengdu, wears robes of black patterned silk, adorned with five-colored phoenix insignia. Upon his head rests the Jade Essence Penetrating-Heaven Precious Crown, and in his hand he holds a five-colored feathered staff. He governs the Right Bureau of the Dark Yin Supreme Obscurity Grotto-Heaven, commanding the immortal officials of Mount Heng, the Northern Marchmount, the earth spirits, water essences, and the legions of Black *Ren*. To the north, he oversees the boundless heavens, the measureless kalpas, and the infinite, inexhaustible bureaus, presiding over the registers of the Supreme Perfected and all subordinate to the Black Emperor Lord of the Jade Bureau. He holds dominion over the life and death of mortals. Those who know his name and visualize his spirit, cultivating for nine years, will summon black clouds and a flying chariot to receive their form, ascending to the Dark Palace.

The *Mingke of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* states: All Highest Supreme Perfected Ones, Jade Emperor Lords, Perfected Ones of the Jade Clarity, the myriad immortals and host of sages, and those who attain the Dao as numinous persons—all bear the *Mingke of the Supreme Perfected*, which regulates the statutes governing the assembled Perfected. It is concealed within the boundless palace of the Nine Heavens, the Seven-Treasure Flower Chamber, attended by seven thousand Jade Maidens of the Great Flower of Literary Essence and nine thousand Gold Spirits and Jade Lads who tend the incense and oversee the numinous. The ancient statutes have endured through measureless kalpas, transmitted to twenty-four persons. Those who treat the statutes lightly or transgress the prohibitions, violating the Jade Statutes, shall have their registers as Perfected Sovereigns erased and be relegated to the ranks of wandering, unattached officials. As stated above, promotions in rank follow merit.

The *Lüwen* of the Right Bureau of the Mysterious Capital, recorded by the Maiden Qing—those who receive it must uphold it with clarity and caution.

The *Mingke of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* states: All scholars who receive the *Mingke of the Nine Perfected*—comprising three ranks and twenty-seven clauses, the upper scroll of the Three Pristine Ones—must keep it secret within the Palace of the Numinous Capital of the Supreme. It is attended by three thousand Pristine Jade Maidens and four thousand Gold Spirits and Jade Lads who guard and tend the incense. The ancient statutes endured for ninety thousand kalpas, transmitted to nine persons. The oath requires ten taels of purple gold and one hundred feet of purple silk to swear before the Nine Heavens. Only those with golden bones and jade names, persons fit for Perfection, may receive it in accordance with the covenant. Master and disciple face one another in retreat for ninety days, making offerings toward the north. Twenty-four Jade Lads and Jade Maidens are assigned. Those who treat the statutes lightly or transgress the prohibitions, leaking the precious formulas, shall condemn themselves and their seven ancestors to the trials of the Mountain of Knives and the Realm of Fire, the twenty-four hells, and the sufferings of the Three Paths and Five Torments for ten thousand kalpas, thereafter serving as lowly ghosts bearing stones to fill the rivers.

The *Lüwen* of the Right Bureau of the Mysterious Capital, recorded by the Maiden Qing—those who receive it must uphold it with clarity and caution.

The *Mingke of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* states: The *Mingke of the Four Poles* is the jade formula of the loftiest sages, received by the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao. It is concealed within the Golden Tablet Purple Terrace Jade Reflection Seven-Treasure Palace, attended by twenty-four hundred Jade Maidens and twenty-four hundred Jade Lads. The statutes endure through measureless kalpas, transmitted only to those with golden names and mysterious charts, whose jade bones bear the green script of the Upper Clarity. The covenant requires ninety feet each of five-colored brocade silks, forty feet of phoenix-patterned gauze, one golden fish, and one jade dragon, each one foot two inches in length, to record the year and month of transmission. These are sealed upon the recipient’s natal marchmount to swear fidelity before the Nine Heavens. Master and disciple face one another in retreat for one hundred days before transmission. Thirty-six Jade Lads and thirty-six Jade Maidens are assigned. Those who treat the statutes lightly or violate the statutes, leaking the precious texts, shall condemn themselves and their seven ancestors to the trials of the Mountain of Knives and the Fire Realm, the twenty-four hells, and the sufferings of the Three Paths and Five Torments for ten thousand kalpas, thereafter serving as lowly ghosts bearing stones to fill the rivers.

The *Lüwen* of the Right Bureau of the Mysterious Capital, recorded by the Maiden Qing—those who receive it must uphold it with clarity and caution.

The *Mingke of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* states: The *Five Victorious Jade Formulas of the Cavernous Mystery Scripture of the Numinous Treasure* are all precious texts of the Supreme, the mysterious chapters of the Jade Emperor. Originally issued by the Nine Heavens’ Father and Mother, they were sealed within the Golden Chamber Purple Portal of the Jade Capital of the Supreme. Emerging once in ten thousand kalpas, one copy is now sealed north of Mount Tai, and another on Mount Laosheng. Only those with golden bones and jade treasuries, whose names are recorded in the Emperor’s registers, may receive transmission once in a thousand years, limited to three persons. The covenant, established at the dawn of the Supreme August, originally used gold coins for oaths; now it requires fifty feet of purple silk, two taels of gold, and two pairs of golden rings to fulfill the sworn pact. Master and disciple face one another in retreat for one hundred days, dividing the silk before transmission. Nine Jade Maidens and twelve Jade Lads attend the scripture. Those who cultivate it shall have their ranks elevated to Immortal Ministers. Those who treat the texts lightly or leak the most sacred, shall condemn their seven ancestors, parents, and themselves to examination by the Left and Right Bureaus, ascending the Mountain of Knives and the Fire Realm, enduring the twenty-four hells and the sufferings of the Three Paths and Five Torments for ten thousand kalpas before returning to serve as lowly ghosts bearing stones to fill the rivers.

The *Lüwen* of the Right Bureau of the Mysterious Capital, recorded by the Maiden Qing—those who receive it must uphold it with clarity and caution.

The *Mingke of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* states: The *Great Characters of the Inner Texts of the Three August Ones*—of Heaven, Earth, and Humanity—are also called the *Cavernous Spirit*, the *Cavernous Immortal*, or the *Supreme Jade Strategy*. Cultivated by the Primordial Humans of the Supreme Origin and concealed by the Supreme Lord of the Dao in the Palace of Great Abundance, they emerge once in seven thousand years. Now, one copy is sealed upon each of the Five Marchmounts. Only those with golden names and jade characters recorded in the Square Cauldrons Palace may receive transmission after forty years. The ritual covenant requires forty feet of white silk, three taels of gold, and—where anciently a white rooster’s blood was used for oaths—now substitutes gold and silk. If no master exists in the world, one must retreat to a mountain, prostrate oneself, and reverently uphold it. Master and disciple fast for three days before making the oath. Nine Jade Maidens and nine Jade Lads are assigned. Those who violate the statutes or transgress the prohibitions shall, after five offenses, have their merit nullified and affairs severed; after seven offenses, they shall perish and be delivered to the Three Bureaus, condemned to the hells of the Three Paths and Five Torments for ten thousand kalpas, thereafter reborn beyond the human Dao.

The *Lüwen* of the Right Bureau of the Mysterious Capital, recorded by the Maiden Qing—those who receive it must uphold it with clarity and caution.

The *Mingke of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* states: The *True Forms of the Five Marchmounts* were concealed by the Supreme August and cultivated by the Supreme Lord of the Great Dao, practiced by the Queen Mother of the West.

chunks.original_text: 五千年三传，若有名书东华，录字帝简，当得此文，四十年内有其人，听得授之。 法盟，五色缯东九尺青，南三尺绛，西七尺白，北五尺皂，中央十二尺黄； 纹、白绢四十尺，斋三日，告盟而传。 有此文，游行五岳，则五帝仙人侍卫兆身，位登仙卿。 有违盟犯律，五犯废功断事，七犯死入地狱，三涂五苦万劫，还生不人之道。 玄都右宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：凡太上威神策、玉帝摄杀策、天帝八威策、上皇紫虚策、元皇飞仙策、太微灵神策、玄元摄魔策、皇文黄帝玉策、太一帝君传、三皇传、五岳传、升仙召魔传，悉秘於东华青宫玉格之上，应为真人者，以传升仙之号。 旧科一千年一出，若有名言青宫，骨法合仙，百年内有其人，亦三传。 法盟并白绢四十尺，金二两，南向告盟而传。 得此文，则五帝司迎，万精伏首，役使群灵。 轻文慢真，五犯不得又仙，十犯死入地狱，三涂之中万劫，还生非人之道。 玄都右宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：凡上清高仙品格之符、豁落七元、流金火铃、夜照神灼、五籍洞玄隐天大符、方丈震灵、灵飞左右、金神虎文、智慧文翰、大洞三十九章玉符，并出旧经之中，若单佩此符，亦可别书。 盟信年限，悉依经科，有犯如之，但得单行备矣。 玄都右宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：金方二十七首、金液丹经、九鼎神图、琅玕华丹、八石练腴、智慧赤药、上化丹方，四十六卷，并仙皇之秘事，藏於九疑之中。 五百年一传，若有名言上清，玉札青宫，皆百年得传。 悉盟誓上金七两，白绢四十尺，以誓九天不泄之信。 得其法，白日升天。 轻泄秽慢，死充三官，负石填河之役，万劫得生人道之中。 玄都右宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：凡修上清道经，《大洞真经三十九章》，入室之日，当身冠法服，作鹿皮之巾，不者葛巾亦可，当披鹿皮之被，无者紫青可用，当以紫为表，青为裹。 帔令广四尺九寸，以应四时之数，长五尺五寸，以法天地之气。 表裹一法，表当令二十四条，裹当令一十五条，以应三十九帝真之位。 尔身被帝皇之章，便应冠带帝皇之服故也。 无有此服，不得妄动。 宝经咏一句，则响彻九天，万帝朝轩，九真扶位，所应不轻。 单衣诵经，天魔侵景，万精乱音，神丧气散，死入幽泉，魂魄艰辛，不得又仙。 有此法服、威章，给玉童玉女各十二人，典卫侍真。 不得妄借异人，并履殗秽，轻慢神服，五犯不得冠身，无复仙冀，十犯被考左右二官，身死被掠刀山食火，二十四狱万劫，还充负石之役。 玄都右宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：凡女子学上清白日升天之法，受宝经玉诀，修行大洞，皆元君夫人之位。 入室之日，当冠元君之服，披紫纱之褐，令用三丈四尺，身幅长短，就令取足。 当使两幅作十六条，身中二十三条，合三十九条。 又作青纱之裙，令用四十五尺，作八幅，幅长四尺九寸，余作攀腰，分八幅，作三十二条。 此则飞青之裙，元君之服也。 身冠此服，万真束带，千魔灭形。 给玉童玉女各十二人，典掌法服也。 无此服，不得咏於上清宝经。 轻以常服诵咏上经，天魔侵景，万精乱音，神散气离，不得又仙。

The *Lüwen* of the Right Bureau of the Mysterious Capital, recorded by the Maiden Qing—those who receive it must uphold it with clarity and caution.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* state: Those possessing golden bones and jade names, inscribed in the Azure Palace, who encounter a scripture master in the world and receive the thirty-one fascicles of the *Independent Oral Instructions of the Precious Texts*, yet remain unable to renounce worldly ties and retreat to secluded mountains—constrained by worldly affairs, or lacking the resources for immortality—may still venerate and pay homage morning and evening, as one would serve a sovereign or father. Even those with spouses may cultivate the Dao of the Seven Scriptures, aligning their qi and observing the celestial measures. However, they must not disrupt the celestial balance, causing qi to scatter and spirits to depart, thereby entangling the true and perfected. The supreme perfected, the imperial effulgences, and the descendants of the Lordless Lady may descend to those of the Dao, forming celestial unions, their qi harmonizing in accordance with the cycles of destiny. How could this be sullied by the turbid and impure? Having received the supreme method yet remaining bound to the worldly path, one must seek the Seven Scriptures, follow their rites, and refrain from recklessly uniting yin and yang or defiling oneself without restraint. Should such acts occur, violating the purity of the retreat chamber—one transgression shall utterly bar one from immortality. Three transgressions shall subject oneself, the seven ancestors, and parents to the scrutiny of the Three Officials, punished with the Knife Mountain and Fire Feast, the Twenty-Four Hells, and the Three Wretched Paths and Five Sufferings for ten thousand kalpas, forever consigned to the labor of the lowest ghosts bearing stones.

chunks.original_text: 玄都中宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：上学之士，奉受宝经，诣师启盟之后，当供奉师宗，礼拜恭敬，如奉神明。 入室烧香，皆当先存师所在，心拜师前，然后行事。 故有告誓之盟，结带之信，其仪甚重，至不可轻。 有违盟负誓，攻伐师本，评论是非，得新忘故，一犯断功废事，不得又仙，三犯上延七祖、已身，并充左右二官考，罚以刀山食火，二十四狱，三涂五苦万劫，长充下鬼负石填河之役。 玄都中宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：奉受上经，诣师登盟，上告九天，下誓万灵，约当宝秘修行道真。 结盟之后，不得绮言妄语，欺诈同学，诱取经书，毁谤师君，兴造无端，露泄宝诀。 以与不盟，罪延七祖，充无极之劫，履刀山食火铄械，三涂五苦之中，己身生世被风刀之考，求死不得，罪魂充於左官，刀山火乡，二十四狱，三涂五苦，累－劫不原。 玄都中宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：凡有金名东宫，紫札玉清，得受宝经，当依科盟传。 审有其人骨相合仙，炼戒无虚，意怀入真，然后告斋，受盟而传。 传付之后，弟子负违，罪及师身，三犯废功断事，不得又仙，五犯死入地狱，三涂之中万劫，还生贱人之道。 玄都中宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：凡男女同学上清之道，共奉师宗，入室斋戒，烧香礼拜，当随所学深浅，上下次第，高上玄鉴，身受三宝奇文。 登盟备以为第一，同有此德，先后次之； 复同年俱备，长幼次之，皆以上德高称之才，为大洞法师也。 不得互争称己，不相推敬，无复次序，为四司所纠。 五犯断功废事，不得又仙，十犯身被左官所考，死入地狱，三涂五苦之中万劫，还生贱人之道。 玄都中宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：凡同奉宗盟师，当令心意和美，气响相参，体行同一，彼此齐并，每令彼此同得道真，俱受师经，白日升天。 不得更相攻伐，斗乱同学，口舌喧哗，谗讪无端，师盟既同，形色不欢，嫉能胜己，竞求取先，遂成各敌。 如是怨家，为四司所纠。

The *Statutes of the Jade Maiden of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* must be received with clarity, caution, and diligent observance.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* state: Those who study the supreme teachings and receive the precious scriptures, after approaching their master and pledging their oath, must serve and honor their master with reverence, as though attending upon the divine. When entering the chamber to burn incense, they shall first visualize the master’s presence, bow in their heart before the master, and only then proceed with the rites. The covenants of sworn oaths and the pledges of bound sashes are of utmost gravity—never to be treated lightly. Should one violate the oath or betray the pledge, assail the master’s foundation, dispute right and wrong, or forsake the old for the new, a single transgression shall sever merit and nullify all progress, barring one from immortality. Three transgressions shall extend to the seven ancestors and oneself, subjecting all to the scrutiny of the Left and Right Officials, punished with the Knife Mountain and Fire Feast, the Twenty-Four Hells, and the Three Wretched Paths and Five Sufferings for ten thousand kalpas, forever consigned to the labor of the lowest ghosts bearing stones to fill the rivers.

The *Statutes of the Jade Maiden of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* must be received with clarity, caution, and diligent observance.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* state: Those who receive the supreme scriptures, approach their master, and ascend to pledge their oath, invoking the Nine Heavens above and swearing before the Ten Thousand Spirits below, vow to treasure, guard, and cultivate the Dao in secrecy. After the oath is sealed, one must not engage in frivolous speech or deceit, cheat fellow disciples, lure away scriptures, slander the master, fabricate baseless accusations, or recklessly reveal sacred secrets. To do so and share them with the uninitiated shall extend the sin to the seven ancestors, condemning them to boundless kalpas, treading the Knife Mountain and Fire Feast, enduring the Three Wretched Paths and Five Sufferings. In this life, one’s body shall be subjected to the torment of wind and blades, denied even the mercy of death. The sinful soul shall be consigned to the Left Official, the Knife Mountain and Fire Realm, the Twenty-Four Hells, and the Three Wretched Paths and Five Sufferings, with no hope of redemption for countless kalpas.

The *Statutes of the Jade Maiden of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* must be received with clarity, caution, and diligent observance.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* state: Those who bear the golden name of the Eastern Palace or the purple writ of the Jade Purity, having received the precious scriptures, must transmit them in accordance with the ordained covenants. Only when one has verified that the recipient’s bone constitution aligns with immortality, their precepts are flawlessly cultivated, and their intent is fixed upon attaining the true Dao, may one then perform the purification rites, administer the oath, and transmit the teachings. Should the disciple betray their vow after transmission, the sin shall extend to the master. Three transgressions shall nullify merit and sever all progress, barring one from immortality. Five transgressions shall condemn one to death and descent into hell, suffering in the Three Wretched Paths for ten thousand kalpas, only to be reborn into the lowest of mortal paths.

The *Statutes of the Jade Maiden of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* must be received with clarity, caution, and diligent observance.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* state: When men and women study together the Dao of the Supreme Purity, jointly serving the master, entering the chamber to fast and burn incense, and bowing in reverence, they shall proceed according to the depth of their learning, ascending in proper order. The most profound and discerning shall first receive the Three Treasures and the wondrous scriptures. Ascending the oath is of paramount importance; those of equal virtue shall be ranked by seniority. If both virtue and seniority are equal, the elder shall take precedence. All shall be judged by the loftiness of their virtue and the excellence of their talent, and the foremost among them shall be named the Master of the Great Cavern. None shall contend for precedence, refuse mutual respect, or disrupt the proper order, lest they be seized by the Four Administrations. Five transgressions shall nullify merit and sever all progress, barring one from immortality. Ten transgressions shall subject one to the scrutiny of the Left Official, condemning one to death and descent into hell, suffering in the Three Wretched Paths and Five Sufferings for ten thousand kalpas, only to be reborn into the lowest of mortal paths.

The *Statutes of the Jade Maiden of the Central Palace of the Mysterious Capital* must be received with clarity, caution, and diligent observance.

The *Luminous Regulations of the Four Poles of the Great Mysterious Capital* state: Those who jointly serve the master and pledge the same oath must ensure their hearts and minds are harmonious, their qi and voices in accord, and their conduct unified, advancing together in equal measure. Each shall strive for the other’s attainment of the true Dao, that all may receive the master’s scriptures and ascend to heaven in broad daylight. None shall assail one another, disrupt the harmony of fellow disciples, engage in clamorous disputes, or spread groundless slander. Though bound by the same oath, if their demeanor betrays discord, if they envy those more capable, or vie for precedence, they shall become adversaries. Such enemies of enmity shall be seized by the Four Administrations.

chunks.original_text: 三犯伐功断事，不得又仙，五犯为左官所考，罚以刀山食火啖炭，二十四狱，三涂五苦，万劫不原。 玄都中宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：凡诣经师告盟，受《上清宝经大洞三十九章》、《四极明科》，当以八节之日，送金镮一双，青缯九尺，以奉於经师。 师得此信，当连条上学弟子郡县乡里姓名年纪生月，於九尺青缯之上正中，於玄岳绝岩之侧，北向奏名青宫，叩齿二十四通，微咒曰：天回气谢，八道运精，三五应期，九祚代倾，本真玄寂，辅臣帝灵，玉札已御，今奏青名，谨关九府，五岳司灵，记我所列，上闻玉清，三年之后，来迎甲形，赐乘八景，升上帝庭。 毕，埋青缯於绝岩之下，如此三年，克有真人下降，语兆神真之道。 受科不奏此名，则青宫无录，四司所纠，则同窃经盗科之罪。 若师仙化，或相去遥远，不得输送镮物，皆当自得施行。 但镮以自盟，奉师之信，不得不送於经师尔。 违一节不送，废功断事，不得又仙，三节违盟，告下三官，罚考风刀，死充地狱，三涂之掠万劫，还生非人之道，师得信盟不奏，罪亦同之。 玄都中宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：凡修上道，当夷心寂意，静嘿守真，出入存念，惟道为身，斋戒执科，计日成仙。 不得忿怒愤激，结气烦怨，骂詈咒诅，引唤鬼神，上触天科，殃延考官。 三犯此禁，万不得仙，五犯上延七祖，下及己身，并充刀山食火啖炭地狱之中，三涂五苦万劫，得生不人之道。 玄都中宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：凡修上清之道，当心念十方蛤飞蠢动，已生未生，咸得道真，成就不死，愿天普隆，功满德就，计日成仙。 不得心怀伐逆，手害有生，始人胜己，愿人危颠，触行无善，惟恶为先。 此禁尤重，考结左官，身被风刀，上及七玄，同被考掠，履陆刀山，食火啖炭，三涂之中，二十四狱，累劫不原。 玄都中宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：凡修上清之道，当令五藏六府肃清，内夷外丹，上下齐精，宝华结络，神秀鲜明。 不得饮酒，醉乱溢盈，翻倒藏府，五神飞惊，愿念不洁，所修不成，内疾攻身，计日腐零。 如此之学，徒劳心情，五犯科律，不得又仙，十犯尤重，上延七玄、己身充责，并履刀山地狱之中，万劫乃原，得生人道之中。 玄都中宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：凡受四极明科三天正法，佩带真文，恒当沐浴，盥洗为急。 每令屐履、衣服盛洁，不使污秽，真灵远离，凶邪所乘。 有犯此禁，五犯退削陆真之爵，十犯左官所考，死入地狱万劫，还生不人之道。 玄都中宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：凡上学之士，受三天正法四明之科，不得妄入秽殗，哭泣悲泪，吊问死丧。 五犯伐功断事，不得又仙，十犯死入地狱万劫，还生不人之道。 玄都中宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。 太玄都四极明科曰：凡上学之士，受三天正法四明之科，佩带真文，出入三光，及眠坐卧息，不得露顶不着巾帽，及脱衣露形，毁慢身神，耻辱真文，令真灵远逝，空尸独存。 三犯不得又仙，五犯死入地狱，万劫还生不人之道。 玄都中宫女青律文，受者明慎奉行。
